post_text: Mother's day is coming up, it will be the first one that my Mom isn't here. Last night I had a dream about her. She came to me and just hugged me, never spoke a word just kept hugging me. I kept saying "Mom", but she still wouldn't speak. I could just feel her embracing me. I woke up with this almost happy feeling, I could just tell by the emotion in the hug it was her.
comment_text: Oh that’s wonderful! I’ve had a very similar dream except it was my brother who committed suicide last year, felt an overwhelming sense of love, I remember I was just crying and saying I missed him so much he just reassured me he was okay, smiled and hugged me , it felt so real I woke up happy 💛

post_text:
Need some interpretation:

I was walking on some land, a vast area covered in green grass and some plains and some little hills/dunes looked like a valley. There was a lone tree. A big massive tree in distance. The leaves were all purple colour and it had some little white flowers. There was wind, not too strong, but the little flowers were flown away in the wind and falling like a flower rain. I was walking past the tree and I wasn’t alone but with someone. I don’t know who that is but someone close/familiar with. They gave me a flower that was caught floating in the air. We were just walking.
comment_text: This is such a beautiful dream. I feel it reflects a sense of peace as you navigate the peaks and troughs of your life at the moment. I feel the tree with the purple leaves represents your spiritual growth. You have become strong and indipendant, perhaps unique in your path. The person you walk with is aspect of yourself who wants you to stop for a memento appreciate how far you have come. You are blossoming into something wonderful!

post_text:
Good morning.

I keep having a dream where in the dream I remember that sometime in the near past I killed someone and then buried the body under my house. In my dream I then can't remember if I actually did it or whether it was a dream and I have a panic attack about it being real and then being caught. Can anyone shed any light on what this might mean?
comment_text: Hi, my suggestion is that the dream is about a dead part of yoyrself that you have burried and tried to forget. Some essential part of you has fallen away. It seems this brings you anxiety because you don't want to feel responsible for this.

post_text: So I woke up from a very strange dream. I often get very vivid dreams but this one was about my nan who has passed.it started very weirdly I couldn't keep up with what was happening like my dream was jumping from place to place.Then I remember speaking to who i believe was my partner when I got upset and said its Christmas we should be celebrating, dancing etc. He goes downstairs comes back and says right come on then let's go dancing. I get up walk to the staircase (it isn't my own it's a big fancy house , I only live in a small council rented property). I get to the top of the staircase look down and my nans there. I can see her talk to her and hug her! I'm very confused she passed why was she ther. In my dream state I knew that something wasn't right. Anyway we start walking to the pub it's in the middle of nowhere. Fantastic scenery surrounded by trees and views but the path is dangerous. Lots of cliff edges, deep slopes that sort of thing. My nan starts walking to the edges she's smiling and I'm scared she's going to fall. She says my name and just carries on. She falls off and lands on a larger person who breaks her fall and somehow they are both OK. She smiles and lends her hand as if to say I should take risks too its ok. I woke feeling like it was a message to stop letting fear control my life but have second guessed it thinking my nan didn't take risks why would she encourage me to in a dream ? Any ideas would be greatly appreciated x
comment_text: What a fabulous dream! Trust your instinct on this one, for sure. This is a clear message from your nan. Go live your life! Be bold!

comment_text:
I can strongly affirm at the least that you cannot ‘dream or imagine’ anything NEW (as in something you didn’t recently see, observe throughout life or as a child, possibly even connecting different aesthetics or characteristics
of animals and such, no NEW details or designs can be created basically, history and life repeat themselves until change is enacted). Therefore, it’s quite possible that because of the larger setting, environment of a big fancy house party and future, you dreamt of perhaps even a thought of living a different life than hers (including yours perhaps at the moment). She could be spiritually messaging you through the afterlife (dream medium) to tell you to take risks. This is similar to how she told you a permanent goodbye in the dream setting, yet you still saw her land safely on someone else and continue on? So basically, she’s telling you that goodbyes aren’t forever if you love someone, and to take advantages of opportunities while you can as ‘risks.’

By connecting logic with your subconscious, you are correct because you cannot just imagine something NEW or create something that you have not seen details of before. You are 100% in the acceptance&refl
ection stage of loss or life in general, thereby you have let go of her control/
influence, however you still love her and value her opinion.

Understand that the only thing stopping anyone from ‘letting go’ is themselves, you may love someone and not need to heed their opinions on your own entity.

Those last few lines are enough to show how you feel, you already understand that ‘you miss every shot you don’t take, but what does getting a shot mean to you?’ philosophy or mindset.

post_text:
I had a dream I was really drunk and I was walking in the street because I needed to get something, I’m not sure what but I was in my pyjamas and I was really nervous I didn’t want people to see me buts heaps of people were out and then I heard a voice asking if I’m alright and I suddenly fainted and a male introduced himself as a nurse and started checking me and said I have a hole in my chest and told me to inhale and exhale but it was hard for me to take deep breaths

What would this mean?
comment_text:
To me this implies a sudden subconscious "jump" in self awareness.

The people were aspects of your deeper psyche you've accessed either as a response to a stimulus, or in alignment with a global phenomenon (spiritual ascension). These may be parts of your psyche that connect with the Collective Unconscious.

You faint when you hear a voice asking you if you're OK. This to me indicates "finding" the right "self" to fall back on.

He was a "nurse".. Very apt. Your New Masculine Energies from this quick shift are very healthy and "healing" for the Feminine energies that are wounded.

Hole in chest (Heart Chakra) is the "sudden" shift in consciousness I mentioned. It could be indicating the cause of this shift eg some emotional trauma etc but you have a very well grounded inner Masculine that is helping you "heal" (your power of discernment, responding instead of reacting, taking action with strategy, being responsible etc).

EDIT: Please look into breathing practices and kindly use them during Meditation.

I always suggest practicing Earthing and Grounding, and increasing water intake. These practices help us "ascend" more smoothly.

Ascension is linked with shadow-work. Shadow-work is linked with self-awareness.
Dreams help us increase our self-awareness.

post_text:
I had an interesting dream this morning. There was lots of elements in the build up. It was all centered around my partner and I getting errands done. We went to the grocery store and went to get haircuts and buy clothes but we only got to the shops half an hour before they closed but the staff let us stay in this store past closing and we chatted with them. Then we headed to see my partners family. I had a really large box with personal stuff in it, I can’t remember exactly what. I left it on the side of the road and throughout the day I went back and forth to it. The last time I went out to it, it was empty and I felt really sad about my things being stolen. I couldn’t remember what was in the box so I tried to just let it go and not be worried about it.

For context, in waking life my partner and I are going to her family’s place for lunch today for Mother’s Day. I also revealed some past trauma details to my partner the other day and as I type this out I am seeing parallels between that and the box on the road. Any interpretations are welcome and appreciated!
comment_text: The box with your personal stuff you let on the side of the road is your trauma you have. The time that you are spending with your partner with getting ready is your sharing this trauma. You are processing this all and you keep going back to check is you checking if it is still there. That it's gone you have moved on from this trauma.

post_text:
I had a recurring nightmare. I think I was around 8 or 9 years old when it started. They happened several times when I was that age and became less frequent as I grew older.

The setting was present-day at our house at the time.

My father's job involved international travel, so he was often away from home. When he wasn't home, my siblings and I would sleep in our parents' room with our mother.

In the nightmare, we heard noise outside the room and realized a group of men broke into the house.

My siblings and I ran and huddled near the door. Eventually the men broke the bedroom door. Our mother tried to block them from entering the room, so they shot her several times. She fell backwards onto the bed. That is when we scream and the nightmare gets cut. Sometimes I would wake up crying.

I would appreciate any help in interpreting my dream. Thank you in advance 💗
comment_text:
Think of the house as your unconsciousness
and the intruders as someone or something that is disturbing that within you. At 8 or 9 that can be many things. It could be an aspect of yourself you were struggling with at the time (I was painfully shy and hated that about myself) or something external as well. Your mother symbolized safety and this issue took that from you.

At that age, I would think you had an underlying fear of losing your one parent you had while your other parent was away. Only your mom kept you safe while he was gone, and you might’ve felt as though losing her would be detrimental.

But if not something as simple as that, someone intruding to me would seem as though a problem/threat entering your house is like a problem/threat invading your mind/peace. Your home is your safe space, just as your peace of mind is a safe space. And if a problem or fear is intruding on that, you’ve got to protect it.

post_text:
I had a very weird dream last night. I sorta kinda know what it means (I think), but I’d like to hear your thoughts.

I was watching a baby. It felt like it was a baby from someone close to me, but I don’t know this baby in real life. I just changed its poopy diaper and within 30 seconds after changing the baby, it looked at me, then at its diaper and I immediately noticed it had pooped again, because baby poop came out at the top of the diaper. I got angry at the baby and smacked his stomach. 😭 Immediately after doing that I regretted it and didn’t understand why I got so angry and violent.

Later in my dream I was on a rollercoaster in a single cart and when I looked behind me I saw the baby, also in a single cart, about 5 meters away from me. I realized that babies are not supposed to be taking rollercoaster rides, especially all by themselves. But at that point there was nothing I could do, so I yelled: “Hold on tight!” Genuinely hoping that that would help. 😅 Anyway, my cart starts racing and a few seconds later I see the baby fall out of the cart and it drops dead on the ground. I felt terrible, but at that moment I kinda realized (or hoped?) I was dreaming and I felt like I could maybe change the outcome, but I don’t remember much after that.
comment_text: You're getting angry and impatient with your own vulnerability, especially when difficult emotions come out. You feel on a rollercoaster ride emotionally, which you fear will destroy that vulnerable part of you.

post_text:
TW: mentions details of death/suicide

Kind of odd that I’d have this dream right before Mother’s Day but last night I had a dream that I watched my mom die. In the dream it started out in a party where myself & my mom were at, separately. I was with one group and I saw her with another. It’s unclear why but my mom volunteered to take some type of lethal pill. I didn’t realize what was going on, until it was too late. People were surrounding her as she lay in the middle of the floor, struggling to breathe. I came over and she told me to give my aunt a message from her before she’s gone. I don’t remember the message now, but I called her up immediately and let her know in the dream. My mom hung around for a while before they noticed the pill wasn’t working, she was still trying to live but very weak. At that point someone there in a red dress grabbed a pillow and essentially put her to rest. I was right there with her until that pillow incident-I couldn’t be near watching it in the dream. I was sobbing in the dream-and retelling it is really getting me worked up. Anyway, I came to ask if there’s some meaning in this dream bc I’m kind of freaking out 😭
comment_text:
Maritza Magarin powerful dream. Theres a few possibilities. Unless your mother in waking life is dealing with end of life issues, the dream is most likely about something other than her death. If we go with the idea that all the characters in the dream are aspects of yourself...the dream may be about a change in your relationship with her. Death of old mother or mother roles. If your mother is changing in life...in decline mentally, or physically.....
..or if she was a difficult mother and you are finally able to release her from that "superior" role....these are possibilities. Perhaps if you are a mother and are choosing to be different with your children than your mother was with you...that too could be the symbolic death of your mother. Essentially its about a change. The end of old. Beginning of new.

post_text:
Thank you for accepting me into this group :’)
I have been having weird / horrible dreams lately and it’s giving me more anxiety than ever before. Hopefully someone can help interpret it for me?

2 weeks ago I dreamt I remarried my husband but it was an all black wedding my wedding dress was black I didn’t see anyone else but him not sure what that would mean but I felt uneasy about it.

The next week I dreamt my 2 year old lost her top front tooth I couldn’t remember the details but that same night my 8 year old dreamt she had stitches.

Last night finally I dreamt of discovering a snake in cage it was red and it had a beak (weird) it didn’t seem to attack me or anything but I felt uneasy and I eventually woke up afterwards.

Is it me? My stress or anxiety?
I have looked online for answers to hopefully see if someone can interpret what it means 😞
comment_text:
Hi, I’m not a psychologist but I do study logic/theory + spirituality and sacred geometry.

1.) the ‘black wedding’ seems to be a passing, or some sort of afterlife meeting, like either you both met again in the afterlife or were accepting some sort of unchangeable loss/
experience.

2.) They’re close in age (fairly), probably were older or in their eternal/
spiritual form in their dreams and fought each other, or they fought as adults in their dreams lowkey LOL

3.) Since nothing else logically makes sense imma assume this is the brain connecting random uneventful things you saw and fused in your subconscious. You may have watched an animal documentary or compilation, and your psyche pieced together a snake, bird, and cage for a pet (these details are all animal related, so that at least connects).

Your husband can be symbolizing something else like your logical side or even something you working. It doesn't necessarily mean anything about your relationship and probably has some other meaning. Two year old losing a tooth dream: it is natural for little kids to be losing teeth so I wonder what your feelings were about this. When we dream about losing our teeth as an adult it often has to do with feeling insecure about changes. A beaked red snake in a cage might have something to do with feing like you're holding back expressing anger but it's really difficult to say without more details as snakes can represent so many things and so can colors.

post_text:
Meaning of a reoccurring setting in my dreams? I’m almost always in a school. But I’m always late, forgot my material, lost, can’t find the right class, etc.. just always lacking.
Only once did I dream that the school I was in caught fire and I went back in and saved multiple people.
Thanks!
comment_text:
As a school setting I usually frame the rest of the dream sround a theme of a life lesson being learnt.

So being late is kind of like its about time your facing up to this, probably not the first time you faced the circumstances but your finally not just ignoring and moving on but taking note of your role in whatevers going on and adapting to stop having to repeat the situation in future.

Forgetting your material I'd see more like you are unprepared to take on this lesson properly, like you need to learn something else first or need to use certain "analytic tools" to understand that you arent willing or comfortable eith to use.

But thats all generalisation,
and dreams are subjective so highly variable.

tired or lost in life) is SHARK TEETH!

treat the finally empty mouth with no teeth. The next dream nights later, I look into a mirror to find hundreds of shark teeth in rows, immediately growing back after prying them out!

post_text:
I’ve had this dream before. It probably isn’t exactly the same but it’s still the same dream.

I visit the town and I walk along the street with someone Idk (but do in this dream). I realise something is wrong and that all of the shops now have weird names. Still their names but either with a night/dream pun or some night/dream logo.
The person idk (Let’s call him P, I guess) sat on a bench and I ask them wth is going on, they confirm it was my town but that it’s called Whoville now. Very confused, we walk into this shop. The manager is walking around shouting ‘Make sure […] don’t fall asleep in my shop!’. Some guy looks drunk and as if he’s going to fall asleep. P helps him out of the shop and he’s grateful.
Soon after, the shops begin to close and the place looks dark and gloomy. All the shops looked as if they were abandoned. Broken windows, lights, and cafés had food laying around. People walking around went into different shops. A group of women were in this café next to me and began eating. Quickly, they all collapsed. P complains that this is just like ‘so and so shop’ and that people just shouldn’t take the risk anymore! I quickly realised that they were all dead.
(For some reason) I and P break the windows of a real estate shop and see this very old, short man with black hair and small glasses. He wore old fashioned but fancy clothes. We talk to him for a bit, ask him questions etc. Turns out that you can either leave your shop in view or hide it. If you leave it in view you can leave a light on to let people know […]. He said that it was stupid and he would never do that. He continues to talk and I look over to see candles lit at a window. I quickly blew them out so that he wouldn’t notice. They came back. I repeated this until I ran to a lever that hid the shop. All of the windows were now gone, replaced by wood. The man ran out back and we followed.
(Idk what happened next)
((THIS IS THE PART I REMEMBER DREAMING ABOUT BEFORE))
He gives in and starts talking about the town and his childhood. Under this shop, there was a huge cavern. As a kid, he and some townsfolk went down there (for some reason). All of a sudden, he found this girl around his age. She wore a gorgeous blue dress and bonnet with white trim. They talked and talked and they had a great time.
The town and he all had to escape the cavern and he begged the girl to come. He dragged her up all the scaffolding with the town. Just as they reached the door back into the shop, part of the scaffolding was gone. The town (already on the other side) tried to help but there wasn’t much they could do. He held onto her and she begged him to leave her here and he jumped successfully to the door. He said ‘We made it!’. But then the girl, still in his arms, said that she wasn’t finished here yet and like a snake slithered out of his arms and fell back into the cavern. The man said that he had stayed there for years hoping to finally be able to save that girl.
I and P both nodded toward each other and we went out the back door and began our climb down into the cavern, the man not far behind us. With our flashlights, we looked around for ages. Eventually, we found the girl who wore the same blue dress. The man was ecstatic and began to talk to her. All was well until all of a sudden she began to transform into this huge snake-like creature (with small legs and she was still wearing the dress). (I don’t remember why but) She began to attack us. Quickly, we ran back up the scaffolding and into the shop. She slithered her way up and partially through the door.

Then I woke up.
comment_text: Hi Mya, so my first thought is that your dream could be looking at your own identity. You could be confused with your own self-image or your sense of self. Could you be looking at your own perception on how you feel others see you at the moment. Just a thought, but I am wondering have you suffered any lost recently, or do you feel at a little lost in life at the moment.

comment_text:
Hi Mya, i looked at the first part of your dream and here s what I see:
***
Shops are essentialy symbols for people.
When we come to earth we do so to pursue our purpose, develop and embody our gifts which we offer to each other hence the shop reference.
The manager usually refers to brain, so the brain is preoccupied with keeping the body alive (ie not falling asleep which effectively means to die in dream language)
P (this is probably your teaching guide) in the dream helps someone out of the shop - meaning helping someone cross over back to the spirit world. This is very important spiritual assistance and I believe the dream is telling you you can do this also.
People (souls) then go to another shop, meaning another incarnation.
When the shop closes (meaning the consciousness leaves the body), place looks dark and gloomy.
Reference to food/death (reminded me of artist Lyubov Panchenko death in Ukraine)

The second part whereby you have a choice to leave your shop in view or hide it, looks like a choice to offer your consciousness, light to others as a support when crossing over - like a 'ferry men'. You can do that during nightime sleep (with conscious commitment before going to bed).
But it seem there is warning that this entails travelling to places where death is present (war zones, nursing homes, hospice etc) which could have certain impact on a being.
Hiding the shop, replacing the windows with wood would be shielding away from this (protection boundaries). Window usually refers to clairvoyance /third eye, so that would be shut.
It s a deep dream and I suggest you ponder on the messages it s giving you especially since you had a similar dream before. Let me know if this makes sense.

post_text: This isn't a dream question. What I am experiencing is something weird. I repeatedly see the number 11 everywhere! Especially in time. Every time I look at clock it's always 11 after. I see it on License plates, Bills. This has been going on for a long time on and off but never this intense and for as long. Does it have a meaning?
comment_text:
I think, as the number 11 is two lines it's about looking for sameness and safety. Being on the outlook for similarity and finding an external safety/
solution. But it could be other things... Our brains are always looking for patterns and even more so when we are in stress. Seeing the number 37 och 49 or 58 might have a different meaning as those lines of the numbers are quite unsymmetrical with eachother. It doesn't really form anything our brains can latch onto. But 11 does... I think we have to see them as a symmetrical shape to figure out what draws our brains to it.

post_text: Wow what a dream. An old coworker came back to town to visit and visited our workplace. My coworkers and old coworker teased me. My old boss was there too but after she had initially smiled at me, she seemed to ignore me mostly afterwards. I asked to leave to run an errand. As I was driving through town I was watching a hawk. As I came around the bend, I thought I saw three more hawks but as one of them came around the tree line, I seen it wasn't a hawk but in fact a massive black bird with a body like the American bald eagle but tail feathers large and shiny like a peacock and a massive wing span as it landed in front of me. It was all black but kinda reminded me of a Phoenix or peacock the size of a bald eagle if not bigger. But it wasn't a peacock or an eagle or any bird I think even exists.
comment_text:
Was this a real life old coworker? What was your relationship with them? There at the same time as your old boss? Your old boss's actions strike me as significant.
You as the bird are shining and unique. Did you feel inhibited or taken for granted, your good work unnoticed, when your old coworker or boss were there in real life?

post_text:
I was walking with my some family members through a very nice neighborhood that was still under construction. There was a small stream that ran alongside the road in front of the houses. One of the houses that was finished had a cheap green plastic netting as a fence, to keep a flock of chickens in the yard.

We went into one of the houses where there was more family. Everyone was sitting and eating. Inwas sitting next to my grandma and the uncle that lives with her and takes care of her. My dad said it was Skylers birthday (my cousin), so I said Happy Birthday Skyler at a loud volume since I was on the opposite side of the room from him. No one else said anything which I was surprised by. I heard someone say "awkward" under their breath.

I left the house with my cousin and siblings. We started down this path that lead into a narrow opening with gray stone cliffs on both sides. We stopped to rest and I noticed a wolf coming out from a hidden cave in the gray stone cliff. Everyone was scared and wolf seemed aggressive. Then more wolves started to come out, one by one, until we were surrounded. While everyone was freaking out, I noticed a small detail and that was thay they were not going to harm us. I stopped Everyone from attacking them. Then the wolves turned into sentient sheep thay had personal affects like bags and staffs and clothing. There were two groups of the sheep, mages and warriors. They started to return to the stone cliff and were grateful we didn't kill them and figured out the truth. My cousin couldn't see they were sheep and still tried to attack the last one. I sent him away and carried the last one, a mage, back to the wall. I looked in its eyes and talked with it, and it was very grateful. It was soft, fluffy, and light to carry.

Then I woke up.
comment_text: May I ask how you feel about the cousin in your dream? How would you describe them?

Meaning?
Thanks!
comment_text:
I actually would look at it in terms of career maybe, with father representing the provider physically (mother provider in the emotional space).

So I could see the father with a heart problem suggesting your heart isnt in your work anymore, tge pregnancy in that context could be a failed job opportunity.

The need to be calm and at peace emotionally (lake as emotions) in order to prepare to try again.

Thats assuming father is right, he has other associations too so I'm gambling on being right, and I'm not a good gambler lol

post_text: I dreamed I had to go and pick up an old friend. He was going to be homeless. He told me he was going to break into a jail where his friend was being incarcerated and stay with him. He has a big rucksack, he asks me "How big do you think the cell is?" I don't suppose there will be room for him, if all sounds very dodgy and like an impossible idea. I wonder if I shoukd ask him to stay with us but he has no money, no job and no plans, I'm not sure I can host him with such uncertainty. We drive to a small asian corner store. I go inside for a sandwich but it's all very busy with lots of foreign men. The sandwiches look really nice, so many fillings and different breads but they are all in a mess in all the refrigerators. I feel overwhelmed in there.
comment_text:
I got the Nine of Swords and Ace of Wands for this. You’re overthinking something...may
be about all the various expressions of creativity you’re interested in—“so many fillings and different breads” ...makes you feel overwhelmed.

post_text: I dreamed I had to go and pick up an old friend. He was going to be homeless. He told me he was going to break into a jail where his friend was being incarcerated and stay with him. He has a big rucksack, he asks me "How big do you think the cell is?" I don't suppose there will be room for him, if all sounds very dodgy and like an impossible idea. I wonder if I shoukd ask him to stay with us but he has no money, no job and no plans, I'm not sure I can host him with such uncertainty. We drive to a small asian corner store. I go inside for a sandwich but it's all very busy with lots of foreign men. The sandwiches look really nice, so many fillings and different breads but they are all in a mess in all the refrigerators. I feel overwhelmed in there.
comment_text:
Working backwards-
Food= emotional and physical nourishment

refrigerator= to have this nourishment in "cold storage", to have this on hold or waiting

Bread=comfort and basic nourishment, many breads, something which seems comforting and basic nourishment, but is taking many varieties, options and forms

Sandwich= relationship where different people have closeness, might be 3 people ie two people who match (bread) who hold things together, and one in between who provides substance and content, this can be like a caregiver format such as two adults taking care of a child.

Sandwich also - close together, perhaps this is a nourishing closeness or perhaps this is a hasty and pressed together feeling closeness. The thought that the dream is about considering someone moving in might suggest that the pressing together of different people into relationship, or overlap of different areas of life, might feel overwhelming

The verb "to sandwich" - to squeeze things in, in a tight or restricted space or time, which can feel pressed or uncomfortable

post_text: Ive had the same dream 2-3 times a week for the last 5+ years. Its in regards to a girl I used to work with between 1998-2002. We were best friends and liked each other, were really close but nothing ever further occurred due to some additional factors. For me its upsetting dreaming about her with the frequency mentioned above. We lost contact in about 2007. All this time later I still dream about her. I don’t fully understand why and I actually wish it to stop. To be in her company 2-3 times a week for 5 years then wake up and lose her over n over is tiring for me. My question is what do my dreams of her mean (we are just together around other people in my dreams in various scenarios and I know in my dreams I feel happy) – why after all this time do I still dream of this, what does it mean and how can I make it stop as I don’t enjoy the sadness. Its got to the point where its upsetting me alot. Even when its the furthest thing from my mind and i havent thought about it, i still find myself having the dream. Many thanks.
comment_text: The dreaming mind chooses people because they work well as symbols for us. I wonder if you could sum her up in a few short lines or some of the issues between you. We woukd also like to gear one of your dreams in order to help you further.

post_text: Ive had the same dream 2-3 times a week for the last 5+ years. Its in regards to a girl I used to work with between 1998-2002. We were best friends and liked each other, were really close but nothing ever further occurred due to some additional factors. For me its upsetting dreaming about her with the frequency mentioned above. We lost contact in about 2007. All this time later I still dream about her. I don’t fully understand why and I actually wish it to stop. To be in her company 2-3 times a week for 5 years then wake up and lose her over n over is tiring for me. My question is what do my dreams of her mean (we are just together around other people in my dreams in various scenarios and I know in my dreams I feel happy) – why after all this time do I still dream of this, what does it mean and how can I make it stop as I don’t enjoy the sadness. Its got to the point where its upsetting me alot. Even when its the furthest thing from my mind and i havent thought about it, i still find myself having the dream. Many thanks.
comment_text:
I think you already know why. It's because you miss her. You can't be with her in real life, so your subconscious compensates this by allowing you to spend time with her in your dreams. It is sad when you wake up and find she's not really there, yeah. At that point, I think it will help to just cry it out. The dreams themselves are actually trying to help you process your emotions, because you're not processing them enough in real life. Instead of trying to stop it, it might be better to appreciate what it is trying to do for you. Thank your dream for allowing you to spend time with her. And for helping you process your feelings for her.

Add:
I'm also getting the sense that there is something you really regret. For one, it sounds like you regret not trying to be romantically involved with her. Two, that you two lost contact. And maybe... a similar situation is happening to you now in the present with someone else. Or something similar that has reminded and triggered you into thinking about her again.

post_text: Ive had the same dream 2-3 times a week for the last 5+ years. Its in regards to a girl I used to work with between 1998-2002. We were best friends and liked each other, were really close but nothing ever further occurred due to some additional factors. For me its upsetting dreaming about her with the frequency mentioned above. We lost contact in about 2007. All this time later I still dream about her. I don’t fully understand why and I actually wish it to stop. To be in her company 2-3 times a week for 5 years then wake up and lose her over n over is tiring for me. My question is what do my dreams of her mean (we are just together around other people in my dreams in various scenarios and I know in my dreams I feel happy) – why after all this time do I still dream of this, what does it mean and how can I make it stop as I don’t enjoy the sadness. Its got to the point where its upsetting me alot. Even when its the furthest thing from my mind and i havent thought about it, i still find myself having the dream. Many thanks.
comment_text: There was something in that girl that you want for your very own. She was a mirror for that something that already exists within you. Your subconscious knows you want that part of her that you love to be part of you and is expressing it through presentation in your dreams. I suggest asking for more specific information about that aspect of yourself you want to bring forth at night as you are going to sleep. Do this every night until you get an answer. Your subconscious has perfect memory and will give you an answer if you are persistent.

post_text:
Quick note: there is someone my heart and head have agreed on... yet I fight upon.
I had made a decision to stop caring and to walk away. To let him make his mistake with his current situation cause he was choosing to believe a liar and a cheater. And so I wanted to not care. Right before going to bed.
I closed my eyes and it happened quickly.

My Dream.
I was in an apartment and in this dream, it was my apartment. I was with my kids and my daughter was watching something on TV. Then the front door opened, and I became afraid and then just felt anxious. I froze. I was shouting “get out, get out.”

I ran to the door, but I felt like I was going in slow motion. I pushed the door closed, locked the top and bottom nob. I even hooked the chain, but I had the sense…this feeling like I was doing something wrong. That I should not have been locking whoever it was out. I know it was a man behind the door. I heard the locks turning…he had a key like he had belonged there. He walks through the door. It felt like this was his place as well, I deep down kept saying get out…out…but I stood there staring at him. Like I was waiting for something. I felt like I was waiting for him to hold me. But I was frozen. He had black hair. I felt that I knew him, but he was a blur. I could not see his face. He stood there as if it was his home, it was our home. I looked at him like I didn’t know who he was, but I knew who he was, and I wanted to him to be there and hold me, but I kept thinking…Go…cause they always leave.
comment_text: The dream is showing you the truth of the matter, you’re afraid he will leave so you want to protect yourself by not caring. It seems wrong to shut him out tho. His face being a blur could mean you don’t really know him, or maybe are afraid to find out.

post_text: There's this dream that a person I know is having, it starts off with him being soft with his ex wife they are cuddling and kissing things start to get a bit heated but then he pulls a knife out and kills her, he didn't want to but its happened he tries to save her but she bleeds out. What could this mean?
comment_text: He may be having a hard time moving on from her. The loss of blood could be a loss of feelings for her.

post_text:
I have had this bodily rash for many months..

This mornings dream I was sitting across from this person and I had someone sitting next me..I began by showing her my rash on my legs and i remember telling her that big salty ocean out there heals everything..i remember pointing it out to her..she agreed it heals everything..
I know there was someone sitting next to me but I cant quite see them...this is all I remember
comment_text: what an interesting dream, it is true that with come skin problems the sea can really help, salt water is an age old treatment to cleanse and sooth the skin. If it were my dream i might be inclined to try it. However there may be a deeper meaning. The ocean may be a symbol for your emotions, perhaps your rash is linked to stress? maybe the dream is asking you to take a more holistic approach, and approach the problem 2 fold, healing the outside - your skin, and healing the inside - your emotions.

post_text:
So.. yesterday morning my SO and I woke up at the sound of the alarm. He immediately said, I just had a terrible nightmare!" I said, "me too! What was yours?" He proceeds to tell me he dreamed he had oral surgery done in a warehouse and he looked in the mirror and had a horrible scar across his cheek to his mouth and he kept trying to call me but his phone wouldn't dial my number.
My bad dream: I couldn't find him, didn't know where he was, hadn't seen or heard from him in a couple days, and I kept trying to call him but my phone wouldn't dial his number!
We have both been super stressed with our jobs but our relationship is in a very good place and we are very good at communication with each other. Why would we both dream we were trying desperately to call each other but couldn't?
comment_text:
Maybe you symbolise his support system and safe space in his dream. So when he feels that something bad has happened, he instinctually looks for you but because he feels helpless or stuck, the line doesn't connect and he doesn't get a relief from his negative feelings. He doesn't manage to feel safe.

And vice versa for you?

Or maybe because you guys are both stressed, you don't want to dump extra negative emotions on each other and thus by keeping it to yourself you feel unsupported and the dream manifested your inner feelings.

I'm just guessing, I'm not a dream expert 🤧

post_text: So I dreamed that I was at my sons school and it felt so real…. As I was looking for my car with my unborn baby in my arms I look up and see it and see my dead grandmother and currently alive uncle but he looked dead both looked like corpses on the backseat I freaked out and look down and my baby disappears I ran to the car and the baby is in there moving around so I get in the car and try to get home but it leads me towards my old road to my grandmothers house across the state I pumped the breaks and do a u turn and try to get back home but more roads keep appearing and I panic and end up crashing the car so I get my stroller and baby and start walking but the closer I get to a building the farther away it goes and I can’t make it and I woke up what does it mean I felt like I kept trying to get home but it kept pulling me back to my old house
comment_text: Isabel Gasca I would interpret this as an unresolved issue from your past that is keeping you from moving forward. It may have to do with family. You want to move forward and create your new life but this has to be dealt with first.

post_text: I was together with a group of settlers. We were me, a warrior and a few others who weren't warriors. We needed to build a place to live in the wild. We found a hillside with grass that seemed good. We started collecting things and I followed the warriors lead. There came some attacking us, two of them were gnomes/dwarves. I managed to keep them at a distance with my knife but given the opportunity I didn't manage to hurt them. I just drew the knife alongside the gnome's cheek and there came a little blood. I really tried to become more ruthless but it was hard. We captured them. I saw so many baby shoes on the ground that I needed to gather up. There were so many. And then I went to collect food and wood.
comment_text:
Hello, what an interesting dream!

I feel this dream is a call for you to come into yoyr power.

The warrior is an archetypal figure that many of us dream of. He is the hero found in many stories. Brave, bold and confident. Able to tackle life's challenges and push through against all obstacles and opponents. He fights for truth, he stands against all that is "bad" in this world and stands up proudly for what he beleives is right.

The dream calls you to be the warrior in yoyr own life.

Living in the wild is about finding yoyr own sense of authenticity. To be who you are in your most natural state. Being unafraid and unashamed in your own sense of self, that who you are, what you beleive on and how you want to show the that to the world.

As you move into the position of the wild authentic warrior you may come across those who wish to attack you, to see you fail or knock you down. Because they themselves are challenged by your sense of pride and confidence in who you are. They will not want you to change, to move away from their controll or beleive about who you are or who you should be.

The gnomes show that you feel yourself to be "bigger" than them. They are no real threat to you when you stand in yoyr power, but they can cause some trouble so best to keep your distance. I feel you have given these people a taste of yoyr new found strength and confidence, but you do not seek to really hurt them.

" I really tried to become more ruthless but it was hard" I feel this is true of yoyr life right now. It is hard to move away from compliance and move towards agency. You do have to be ruthless, you have to put yourself and your own needs first.

I feel the baby shoes on the ground are a symbol of the immature steps you have taken in life on the road to maturity. Perhaps in the past others have had to clear up after you If you have made any bad decissions etc. Perhaps there is some clearing up for you to do now as you learn to deal with your own affairs. Once you have everything in order you will be better able to meet your own needs.

One idea to consider, others might offer alternative suggestions.

post_text:
Please help me interpret this dream

So i have this fresh milk in the bottle and i got it from someone who claim its good quality. However (and for unknown reason) I've got the sudden feeling that this is not a pure milk but instead, a poisonous one. But even though i had that weird thought, I still bought it from the store because a friend of mine suddenly showed up and i dont want her to question the store's credibility too.

After buying the milk and losing my friend from the mall (since she also have errands to do), i quickly lined up on this another store and asked them to clean the bottle of the milk and scan the beverage for its ingredients or content. Suddenly, this friend of mine also popped up in this store and this time i have the feeling that she's suspicious of the milk's content too. Apparently when the lady that scanned the milk came back, she said that it's 90% milk content so, I quickly reasoned myself out to my friend and said that I just wanted to get the bottle cleaned but deep inside, I still doubt this and thought that I'll just throw it out once im home.

After exiting the mall and while walking down the street, i sensed this one man looking suspiciously at us. I grabbed my friend's hand and pulled her to walk faster and exit these streets but more numbers of men got up and chased us. We continuously ran until we reached this street where another group of men is waiting for us. And this time, I couldn't pull my friend to run anymore, she just stopped and stared at them this time.
comment_text: It seems what you think and do has consequences that you sometimes feel deeply responsible for. You have to conduct yourself in ways that doesn't influence people in wrong ways, so sometimes you try to hide your thoughts and intentions. There are parts of yourself you try to keep pure and preserve their innocence.

post_text: Last night I dreamed that I was walking, with difficulty, along a path on a sheer mountain face, I think with someone else. Climbed up on a big, wobbly rock. I tried to make it stop wobbling, but the next thing I know I'm falling backward through space, with no end in sight. I keep having these dreams about falling off a mountain, and of a mountain standing in my way - the same one every time. I'm in kind of a bad way, physically and emotionally. This feels like a warning, to get my act together. What do you guys think?
comment_text:
The analogy is that you're climbing a slippery slope. It sounds like there is something you want to overcome or a goal you want to reach. But to get there, you have to climb up (work at it) this mountain (obstacle in your way). However, you don't believe you can do it. You think you'll slip, and so you do, every time. And when you do slip, there is no one there to catch you. You fall into a black oblivion, because you don't feel supported in your climb. You feel like you're on your own, and you don't believe you can do it.

I'd use this dream to tell myself to have more trust in myself, and faith in other people. And also, that climbing this mountain is very doable.

post_text: What does it mean to have sexual dreams about a particular someone? Lately, I've dreamt sexually of Kaley Cuoco likely due to having sexual fantasies about her. If there's any other reason that happens, I'm interested to know.
comment_text: Often dreaming of having sex with someone can happen when you have a desire to embody the dominant trait you see in them. Or if it is someone you don't care for in waking life it can be realizing you body a trait you don't care for that you're projecting onto them. Or they could even represent an action or a career for example, if the person is a coach and you are thinking you might enjoy becoming a coach you might have a dream you have sex with someone you know is a coach. But it sounds like your dream is more literal.

post_text: I’ve been having violent nightmares once again. I am a recently born again Christian after finally having enough of this. I’m so beyond tired of this crap. This is awful and I’m hoping it changes with continuous prayer.

Im inside my house and I see masked figures outside slamming into the windows of my house. Over and over again. The next day I was in my living room and noticed water damage coming through all of the walls/ceiling (some context last year we had some water leaks and it left our house cut open for the better part of 8 months waiting for contractors that in itself was a nightmare) as I looked closer at the walls I noticed they almost looked like they were molding or looked very old and cracking with scars on the walls, I looked up to the top left and there was a large, almost demonic alien full head/face imprinted in the wall, like as if the face was inside the wall pushing out. It had a very large cranium and smaller mouth comparable to an alien, this shit was scary looking. To my wife I said wtf is that! I then noticed halloweeny decorations all around the house and at that point I lost it and said babe did you put these decorations up?? She said no. All of a sudden a giant owl flew smacking straight into the window glass with force, I immediately ran outside to find I was in a cul de sac and the owl was hanging in front of the window connected to a long clothes line that was attached to a home across the street.

post_text:
Hi. New to the group. I had a dream that has been bothering me.

Background: I dated someone in 2015. The person broke up with me out of nowhere, when things were going pretty well. Over the phone, mind you.

We were both young and this person wasn’t ready to settle down. This person was perfectly decent and I cared for them a lot, at the time.

I was heartbroken, but I moved on.

This person reached out to me in 2016 to apologize, but I immediately cut them off, and respectfully told them I was doing great, had moved on and wasn’t interested in their apology, friendship or otherwise. I wished them a beautiful life, sincerely and wholeheartedly.

Fast forward to last week. This person comes to me in a dream.

We are in the same place, they wave at me to get my attention.

I tell them “Hi, nice to see you but I can’t talk. I’m late to pick up my kid from daycare.”

They keep saying something I can’t understand, and I’m in a rush and get to my car. I then find the car has been hit / is dented and the tires are flat. This person is gone and I’m stuck there.

*I wake up.*

The next morning, out of curiosity, I type their name on Facebook and after some digging, I find out they died unexpectedly last summer. Young, seemingly healthy person. Poof gone.

Now, I’m here feeling sad and spooked.

Any interpretations? Thank you!
comment_text: In the dream you’re rushing and feeling like it’s too late to stop and listen to what someone has to say to you. In real life you cut him off when he wanted to apologize, so you didn’t listen then either. You need to take more care, slow down and concentrate on what’s important. The flat tires mean you’re going nowhere, you’re feeling stuck.

I was hit in my left thigh. I was then taken to a field doctor to stitch me up. While waiting for the doctor I was able to pull out 2 bullets on my own ( they were .22 c) and then the doctor walked in while I was doing so and just laughed and jumped in to finish. The bullets might represent what is wounding you. The different caliber bullets might be symbolizing some wounds are more significant than others. The numbers associated with the calibers could be significant to the dream meaning. Two might be related to a partnership. Four symbolizes stability and 5 is the number of change and freedom. You might feel that while you are capable you might need some professional help to heal/move past some of those wounds.

comment_text: A lot of times dreams can give us warnings to our physical state. Especially from this, the blood, guts, helpless suffering, is your body trying to get your attention. If you're waking up gagging it's very possible you're having acid reflux while you're sleeping and your body is trying to wake you up. Since this is a recurring thing, I would look into it. There are also other issues that occur while sleeping like sleep apnea and what not, but the gagging thing really sounds like reflux

Last night I had many dreams.... First I caught a plate full of Blue Fish. My dad said to clean them and eat them but instead I took half of he plate and threw them back in the water. I was going to pretend I ate them... Then I looked in the water and they were so close to the surface I felt like maybe I should scoop them back up and not lie but.... I let them swim away.

Hi all. I can usually figure out what my dreams are about and why I dream them. Not the dream last night. Also, sometimes some of my dreams just don't seem significant. But last night's dream did. I really hope someone can help me figure out what I'm supposed to know. Here's the dream:

I was somewhere, a house maybe, with my husband getting ready to leave so we called an uber. The car came and the driver seemed a little nervous. I just figured he was a new driver. I got in and my husband hadnt come out yet.

. The guy started driving and I was a little concerned because my husband hadnt gotten in. But I reasoned the driver was just going to turn around at the end of the street.

He looked at me in the rear view mirror and smiling he asked if I was comfortable. I said I was. He had a relatively kind smile. But he didn't turn around at the end of the street. He kept going.

He drove right into a giant garbage dump. The garbage was almost up to the door handle of the car and I knew I was in trouble. That's when I saw a brown and white spotted rat. It jumped in the car and into my lap. Of course I was freaking out and it seemed the driver's intention was having me be attacked by rats. But with all my courage I grabbed the rat with both hands and angrily started poking it in the driver's face. I was filled with anger and fear. It didn't faze him. He just sort of chuckled.

And that was it. Nothing else. Everything I read about dream symbols pertaining to rats, being abducted and even the color of the rat wasn't good.

If you've read this far I am grateful and hope you can help me come up with some insight.
comment_text: It could be about something you are doing that husband isn't on board with or your husband could be your logical action oriented side in the dream and you've left that behind as you are pursuing something that turns out to be not as expected and becomes a negative experience for you. Rats and the driver with ill intent might be symbolizing people that seem to be against you. Since the dream deals largely with your destination in the car it might have to do with how your career is going if you work and the feeling of other people spoiling your enjoyment or progress in that area of your life.

post_text:
Hello. I have a reoccurring dream about the man who used to molest me as a teenager and I need help to understand what it means, I feel like there has to be a reason I keep having it.

I dream that I’m back in my childhood bedroom. It’s not the only bedroom I had in childhood, but it is the one in the home we shared with him, and the room I had through my most formative years. The room is barren, but I’m painting it a baby blue color. Suddenly I notice he’s in the room with me; I’m not sure when he came in, but when I turn around he’s painting over my blue with a dark red. I start screaming “Stop! Can’t you see I’m trying to paint it blue? Why can’t you see that? Stop!” He ignores me, and suddenly the bat I used to play softball with in the time I lived there is in my hands. I start hitting him with it, and I’m crying and saying “Please stop painting it red, I’m trying to paint it blue.” I can feel the resistance of my bat hitting him, I’m swinging as hard as I can, but I never see it hurting him. He continues to standing facing away from me as I hit him.

And that’s where the dream always ends and I wake up having cried in reality during my sleep.
comment_text:
Hi, firstly I am so sorry this man hurt you and that you are still suffering in this way.

My thoughts are that the dream is calling you to do some further work.

Being in the room you shared tells me that the dream is about the mindset you occupy around this issue.

There are allways many threads to the symbols and lots of different ways to approach them. My interpretation is just one suggestion.

It seems the room has been cleared in preparation of remodelling and renovation. Your psyche needs an update in some way.

Yet you used the word "barren" so it may also be that this space internally has become a barren and empty place for you. I wonder if you have tried to clear away the issue in some way, or you just want to paint it over and cover up what happened. Maybe that's something you tried to do when you were young.

Baby blue suggests an innocence. A colour we might paint for a new baby's room. Blue is the colour of the throat chakra, the centre of ouf communication, it invites us to talk and express ourselves, especially verbally. It's also a colour of peace and tranquillity.

I feel that the painting is a way of saying i want to start again. I want to prepare for a new beginning, to clear away the old and welcome in the new. The colour is "light" and invights those themes too.

But the man seems to have too much power because he is allways able to undo your efforts. Red is a very emotive colour bringing thems of lust, passion, danger and anger.

I feel the scene is describing what occupies your mental space over the issue. It seems he is still able to take over and "colour" things. Im sure this experience in many ways has "coloured" or informed the rest of your life, perhaps with a darkness.

Your asking him to stop is very possative because you recognise the unwanted and ongoing influence in your life.

But your pleas and physical attempts to make it stop are not working. And I feel this probably the crux of it. It's very very sad and unfair, this man violated you when you were a powerless. He broke the law, the trust of your family and broke every sacred boundary that is held by good decent loving people. The softball racquet I feel represents your efforts as a child who mearly did not have the power to make it stop by her own efforts. That was not your fault and I feel the dream is repeating because it wants to call you forward as the adult you now are. It's replaying this internal video because its still playing out in various ways within you. You need to address the issue to get the dream to change and hopefully stop.

If this were my dream I would look towards finding a good psychotherapist
and begin by bringing them the dream. There is obviously a lot of pent up emotion that is being held within you.

The painting shows that you want to start over. Painting your own childhood room and the location of your pain, suggests you want to welcome the child who you were. She still lives within you, painting her room in a new and fresh way invites healing and saftey and a way to refresh yourself for a new start. I feel a psychotherapist
will be able to help you with this. Make sure it's not a councellor though as they wont have the expertise. You need someone trained in dealing with these specific traumas. Thank you for sharing your dream with us and taking a very posative step towards healing xx I wish you much courage and live as you move forward x

comment_text: As someone whose also experienced sexual trauma, I have had dreams like this. I see the painting of the room as you setting out your life and goals and making plans for what your life will look like. Him painting over your blue I think represents how his actions have changed the colour of your experience. I think the meaning of the colours is significant too, blue being a safe and peaceful colour vs the red representing violence and anger and negativity. Your act of hitting him not affecting him I think probably represents your retaliation to the trauma he put you through and feeling like even if you fight back it’s not going to be effective. I think the reason you’re having this dream is to process the loss of childhood and innocence and control over life. This is just my interpretation and I might be projecting a little given my own experience but hopefully that resonates with you.

Hello. I have a reoccurring dream about the man who used to molest me as a teenager and I need help to understand what it means, I feel like there has to be a reason I keep having it.

comment_text:
Emma Leigh Espinosa the interpretations
above are beautiful. I think this sounds useful, what has been said. To add to this is the dream image of a bedroom can mean one's own privacy, one's own unconscious, and one's view of sexuality. Which he has given you a darker view of these things than you naturally would have. Softball means you are not "playing hardball" you do not feel that you were tough enough about what happened to you.

I am going to make a suggestion of what to do which was advice my mother gave to me when I was a child and would have the same nightmares over and over.

She told me, before I go to sleep, to tell myself about the monsters "i am not afraid of you!" She said if anything is chasing you in a dream, to turn around and face it "you don't scare me, you can't hurt me, I am not afraid of you!" And it will be less scary once you face it. I think this is true in waking life working through c-ptsd triggers, and it is true in dreams as well.

If you keep hitting him with the bat in the dream, see if you can try having any awareness in the dream that you can try something else. You could try "this is my room. You are not allowed in here"

Or simply "you don't hurt me, you can't scare me, I am not afraid of you"

Because he turns his back on you in the dream, and because also about how others commented on "painting over" can mean to try to cover or conceal the surface, it makes me think that the dream is about "facing him"

You can do this in a dream, by looking into his face and telling him "you can't hurt me anymore I am not afraid of you"

But as mentioned, you can do this in therapy or journaling.

There is an option where you could ask a therapist about "role play" the idea of the therapist standing in for this abuser while you tell him what it is you need to say to him.

You can also do this with mental rehearsal of conversations and or with letters

A "confrontation fantasy" which is either imagined, or played out in therapy, or that eventually actually happens in real life - this is a huge part of healing from sexual abuse 💖

Much love to you in your healing journey 💙💜 the fact that you are having the dream is showinghow strong and resilient that you truly are, that you are recovering and gaining strength and working through this. It sounds like you are at a close point to having a breakthrough and that's why your mind is nudging you with these dreams

There is no way out, but through 💙 keep going and you will get there! 💚

Why us he painting it red? Danger perhaps? Blood? The bat, a phallic shaped object, you turned the "wood" back on him because that's how you felt perhaps, that he was hitting you constantly with his "bat" behind your back? Overall it's the feelings that matter. Those feelings in the dream are the feelings he made you feel. That's what wants to come out.

comment_text: I truly wish there was a single definition of dream symbols that would allow everyone to interpret their own dreams, but there is no such definition. For me, baby blue is a light color of blue and is a mixture of blue and white. In my thirty plus years of dreaming and interpreting, blue is the color of wisdom and white is the color of spirituality. Red is the color of emotion and since it is a dark red, it would be a very deep emotion which would be understandable in this dream. For you Emma, I sincerely hope what I have said is of some help for you.

post_text:
Had such an odd dream!!
It was like I was back in another time and men were very domineering over women, it seemed like the men were treating their women like slaves and they were getting paid for it, like a pension. Even though the men were working, they were getting some extra cash from the government for having a wife but the women were unaware of this injustice. It was like they were imprisoned in their own homes.
So I walked into a house and started demanding that the women be set free and aware of what was going on. It wasn’t about breaking up a marriage, it was more about giving them some freedom, I just sensed a mass injustice. This guy was trying to overpower me so I basically told him I will absolutely beat the crap out of him if he keeps doing this. He was being a smart arse so I grabbed him and started punching him in the face and then his wife was free.
I then followed her and then we kissed.

Next moment I was somewhere looking at some cycle, like it was repeating itself and I said to my son about things never change! I wish I could remember the details more but it was like I kept seeing the same things

Now makes me wonder if I did something in history and now I’m paying for it 🤔
comment_text: It could just simply be a reflection of what you see going on in society and thinking that it’s like old patterns never change, they just keep recycling.

post_text: I recently had a dream I was in a Cathedral church with my Grandma and a man I never seen. My Grandma was in a wedding dress with a bouquet of white flowers and 2 pink flowers. It starts off with us walking in the church, then I was sitting in the pews and my Grandma walking out the church saying She needed to go find St. Anthony. After that my Grandma was lost and we couldnt find her. I woke right after that. My Grandma is still alive.
comment_text:
Grandma could be symbolizing your inner female wisdom. Wearing a wedding dress and pink flowers in a church could have to do with making a commitment to self love and spirituality/
religion. St. Anthony is patron saint of lost objects and lost people. Perhaps you have lost some connection to the church or your spirituality that you wish to regain.

post_text:
Okay weird one..
Saturday night around 10/11pm I was quite irritated I wasn’t falling asleep since I had a lot to do as soon as my feet hit the floor Sunday morning. I had been laying there for quite some time with my eyes closed. I opened my eyes (without my glasses mind you) and saw what looked like a Black Sea urchin but with not as many spikes and very wiggly. It was RIGHT infront of my face. I gasped and leaned back away from it. I watched it for about 30 seconds move. It slowly made it way to a shadow on the wall almost like it was hiding just out of sight in the shadow. I closed my eyes obviously and willed it away I suppose. I rolled over and forced myself to sleep. But man oh man what the hell was that?

I have been a sufferer of sleep paralysis and have also done my research on Hypnagogic hallucinations. I had a occurrence earlier in the year that was very similar to this but it was a swarm of beetles flying and crawling into the upper door way of my bedroom. The night before this recent occurrence, my four year old son woke up talking about dreaming of beetles. Maybe that part is a coincidence. But, please leave me your thoughts. Thanks! 🙂😅
comment_text:
Hallucinations are pretty common if you are overtired or moving into sleep. I often notice my mind starting to have random dream like visions/
activity while awake but beginning to drift off of I am pulled out of that process by becoming more fully awake.

I gasped and leaned back away from it. I watched it for about 30 seconds move. It slowly made it way to a shadow on the wall almost like it was hiding just out of sight in the shadow. I closed my eyes obviously and willed it away I suppose. I rolled over and forced myself to sleep. But man oh man what the hell was that?

I have been a sufferer of sleep paralysis and have also done my research on Hypnagogic hallucinations. I had a occurrence earlier in the year that was very similar to this but it was a swarm of beetles flying and crawling into the upper door way of my bedroom. The night before this recent occurrence, my four year old son woke up talking about dreaming of beetles. Maybe that part is a coincidence. But, please leave me your thoughts. Thanks! 🙂😅
comment_text: I’ve noticed a weird uptick in hypnogogic hallucinations lately… I know they’re fairly common, but I just had one myself where I felt like my wrist got grabbed by a small hand. Not just me though, it seems like everyone is dealing with them more than usual

post_text:
Dream Rant:💭
Every night before bed for the first 2 months after my mom's death I would manifest that I wanted to see her in my dreams. She only appeared a few times though. Now every night I can't help but think of how much I miss her right before falling asleep, not manifesting anything & now I dream of her almost daily...
Half of the times the dreams are the same thing. She died but then somehow she came back to life. But somehow I knew she was going to die again so I would call or text her frequently to check up on her to make sure she's okay but I was always scared when she didn't respond...sometimes it took her weeks to respond (in real life she was the opposite).

Why am I so scared of loosing her again even though she's already gone?
comment_text:
I'm so sorry you mum has died. In my opinion not all the dreams we have of our departed loved ones are visitations. This series of dreams you are having, to me, feel like greif dreams. If you had spent a long time asking her to appear in your dreams, and usually focus on your sorrow before sleep, then there's probably a lot for the dreaming mind to work through. Its not unusual to dream soon after loss that our loved ones never really died, or that they have come back to life. Its so unbeleivable they have gone, we miss them so much and it takes time for the heart and soul to come to terms with the fact they have passed on. It seems you are dreaming that you can communicate with her which is probably something you wish you could still do, and is indded the purpose of your manifestation request. I feel the part where she dosnt respond to your messages is the dreams attempt to help you adjust to the fact that she has gone.

If you find the dreams upsetting you can ask the dream to help you accept your loss in another way. Perhaps you could ask your mum to show her loving spirit in other ways too.

Sending you my warmest condolences x

post_text: Had a dream last night where I met a girl on the beach, got to know her a bit, and watched the sunset with her and my family. Soon after, a great prehistoric-looking water creature showed up and the creature's minions forced her to get eaten while I could do nothing to save her. Feeling horrible, I moped about for a while until I obtained help from my family and a scientist. Together, we searched for solutions on how to go back in time and save her. We eventually did just that destroying the creature in the process. However, no matter what we did, there was always something off about the timeline. I imagine this may have multiple meanings so what's your take on it?
comment_text: The sunset could mean something drawing to a close. The girl may be representing your emotions that are eating you up and you’re feeling helpless to do anything about it. You’re looking for a solution to this. The scientist may represent trying to be more logical and less emotional. Going back in time may mean reviewing the past and what happened back then. The timeline is off...maybe that means you’re still waiting to make the right connection?

post_text:
My dreams are usually very vivid and sometimes come true. God Forbid this were to ever come true, but if I don't put it out here, I'm never sleeping tonight.

I was at my house after work with friends hanging out. There was string in one of their hairs, so I started pulling it out. Then, her hair started coming with it. It was like 3 feet of her hair, although it wasn't that long. We talked about how weird it was, but didn't think much of if.i asked if I should just throw it away, admiring how soft and thick it was.

As we were having this conversation, we heard a vehicle driving around making frequent stops and getting closer. As the vehicle approaches and stops, I get a weird feeling and quickly throw the hair in the trash. My friend was sitting on the front stairs of the porch, and I was right inside the door with the other friend in the kitchen. .

I hear this man ask if my friend is "Danielle". This is my daughter's name and she says yes. (Somehow in this dream she changed people). He walks over and asks her to go with him. He is a super creep. I ask h8m to leave and he sits and keeps talking. I ask my other friend to get my g.un, she does.

I've asked him to leave again, but doesn't and is closer. I have it ready to go and pointed. As my friend asks if I'm OK, I said yes and the accidentally pulled the tri.g.g.er kill ing him .

The next scene, my daughter is gone, the guy was in a printer machine, like folded up and it seems that that is where he was when the prior event happened. My friend had turned into a different friend and we were trying to figure out the best way to dispose 9f it...

Then, I panicked, wondering how long fingerprints stay on bullets, that eventually I would be caught. Then, I was gonna call the cops and claim self defense but trealized how stupid that would be, because he was in a printer now.

This is when I woke up.

Help?

Background, my daughter did just deliver a baby, he has a severe genetic condition and she has post Partum Depression. The baby was admitted for 13 days and I finally had to go fight ti get then home. I di own a g.un, but I feel like I would never need to do what I did IRL

I'm not sure if it has something to do with this and if so, how/what? There isn't really anything else significant happening in life right now.

You had to stay focused in order to get them home and you had to take the action that you felt was right. Maybe the guilt is from wondering if you did the right thing? Or if you could have handled it in a different way? The creepy guy might be her depression. I’m not sure what the printer is representing...
did they give any kind of printout about her diagnosis? The hair may be your thoughts about everything; it being soft may mean you’re feeling compassion for your daughter.
Best wishes for her recovery 💐

post_text:
*massively long one, containing some violence and gore*

Yet another vivid dream. That's 2 days in a row now. This one has more of an obvious meaning but there's still some gaps that are missing for me.

My mum, my dad and my sister went to the library for research on something (can't remember what). Only me and my sister were allowed in because of Covid for some reason, so mum and dad went back to the car outside.

My sister and I sat at a computer. It was odd because she was around 6 years old in my dream, but she's coming up to 12 years old soon in reality. She was acting very mature and I don't know if it's relevant or not but she had a terrible cold, that of course I was worried was Covid. We got on very well and I looked after her like a parent would their own child.

Suddenly, I'm rushing to get back to the car but my sister was no longer there. I lose my phone somewhere and I'm freaking out massively. I really needed my phone and I felt incredibly unsafe without it.

Now I'm at my mum's and going through loads of bags to try and find my phone. I went upstairs in a panic and found my dad drinking in secret. *In reality my dad is an alcoholic but has been sober (at least that's what he tells me) since being in hospital in December last year* I was so angry and I started screaming at him, telling him how selfish he is and that he knows what will happen if he keeps going.

I went back downstairs, because I was done with him, and had a message waiting for me (I'm assuming on someone else's phone) saying that they had my phone and was bringing it round.

I answer the door and find a man in a mask. He hands me a white iPhone, which I know isn't mine but I take it anyway. I go to close the door and he pulls out a small knife that he proceeds to hold against my rib cage.
"You're not even going to pay me for that phone" he says.
I scream and my dad appears. I tell him this guy has got a knife on me but my dad doesn't seem to do anything.

It's a bit blurry at this point, but somehow the man gets stabbed to death. I'm not sure if I did it or what. I find out by the police that he was a very dangerous serial killer and has brutally murdered and disemboweled hundreds of women, of which they showed me photos. It was very disturbing.

Now I'm standing near some railings overlooking the sea. There are some people around me and one person calls my number. I find my phone at the bottom of my bag and I lose control of my emotions.
I look up to the sky and thank God, over and over again, for allowing me to find my phone. I was hysterical and couldn't breathe, clutching onto the railings as I sobbed.

I'm still crying in my mum's living room. I pulled out the iPhone from earlier and noticed it belonged to someone called Kate. I put a post on FB trying to find her so I could give her the phone back. Then I was told that she was one of the man's victims.

Again, I lose control of my emotions and wonder why all of this was happening.

Then I wake up.
Any thoughts?
comment_text: Could you discuss what you see as the obvious meaning and what you don’t understand? That would make it easier.
