post_text:
I had a dream months ago that I can't seem to get off my brain. When I do dream they are vivid and many details. My dreams come true. I've had many dreams where there's no way my subconscious could possibly know what is going to take place yet it happens. This one dream I can't seem to shake.

I died in my sleep. I was a spirit. There was someone talking to me. I don't recall seeing what it looked like. The feeling I had is so hard to describe as I've never felt something like it. There was no pain, no worrying, no fear. Just calm, relaxing and pure peace. I don't feel like my description justify how wonderful it actually felt. The voice asked if I was ready to move on. I stated back that I'm going to stay here with my children. Weather I'm alive or a spirit I'm not going to leave them. I will stay with them to help them through their lives. When they have children I will be here for them too. Shortly after this I woke up. The feeling of complete peace lingered in my body. I was happy, relaxed and calm when I woke up. It was such an incredible feeling.

Even though I don't have any beliefs of what comes after death, I'm not scared of death. So I know my dream is not a fear of me dying. I have searched for a meaning and anything I come across, I'm not able to relate to. I do question if I agreed to move on if I would have actually died. I'll never know because no matter what I will always stick behind my decision.

Anyone have a thought of what the purpose of this dream was?
comment_text: Jennifer Susan to be clear this is just one persons opinion. I'm not going to interpret this symbolically. Because to me...this fits exactly with what I personally believe happens after we leave this body. Right down to the calm and peaceful feelings. In my mind...this world is like a school. We come here to learn very specific things we can only experience in a physical body. Then we go back to our natural spirit state. The person talking to you was your guide. And as on earth, we also have choices to make in spirit state. I see this dream as an affirmation.

post_text:
What does it mean to always have my ex in the background of all my dreams heckling me?

Basically my ex was emotionally abusive and manipulative, cheated on me, and I found out in a way that left me very mentally unstable for a long time. Years later now I'm happily married to someone else, but I continue to be haunted by dreams of my ex still giving me a hard time about things, making me feel bad about myself, or just randomly in the background of my dreams making snarky comments.

If anything, I thought my dreams were a way for me to finally tell him off and get the last word out, but it doesn't stop.
comment_text:
I think at times there is a way that someone's negative attitude towards us we can internalize that negative attitude and it can later lead to self doubt.

Part of this is because we stayed in the relationship, so we were accepting those comments, in some way, it got internalized, like "maybe their criticisms are correct"

I think if your ex shows up in your dreams, it is a symbol of someone you KNOW not to listen to, you KNOW is negative and doesn't want the best for you, you KNOW you want this negativity out of your life.

Therefore, if your ex shows up in dreams complaining about you, it can be a sign of:

1. In waking life, you are being accepting and welcoming of someone else's negativity. You can find a way to cut this down or to stand up for yourself, if you have this situation to deal with

2. That you have been having negative thoughts about yourself, and you know those aren't true, so it is time to cut that out and be lovelier and sweeter to yourself 💜

My two cents Ali Pinlac it doesn't mean this person is coming back in your life, it means they represent a symbol of criticism which you know is overly harsh, and something in your waking life is reminding you of that.

post_text: I apologize if this is long, but i need to give a back story for ppl to really understand. Let me start by saying, I am 51 yrs old now. Many yrs ago, my family lived in a neighborhood with alot of kids. We only lived there for 2 yrs and during that time, I was 14 and 15 yrs old. There was a boy who had a huge crush on me, I will call him john. I was a bit of a tomboy and i didn't have the same feelings for him. To me he was just a friend. He loved hanging out with me so he accepted being just a "buddy", tho i knew his feelings were deeper. We were together all the time for 2 yrs, then we had a bad argument and i wouldn't hang out with him anymore. Shortly after, we moved from there and i never saw him again. But everytime i ran into to ppl from the neighborhood, they would tell me how devastated he was. Even adults told me he must have been truly in love with me, even at such a young age. Now fast forward, all these decades later, I have started having recurring dreams about John. For several months now, at least 3 times a week, I dream that we run into each other and we are sooo happy to have found each other again. In the dreams, we are both willing to leave our current partners and do whatever it takes to be together. The real strange thing is...when I wake up, I am very sad and disappointed that it was just a dream! I wake up feeling like i have lost something very special in my life. Let me add that i am happily married to my partner of the last 10 yrs. I hate to sound cold, but at the time john and i parted ways all those yrs ago, it seemed insignificant to me. I had no romantic feelings for him then, so why in the world would i have them now? Or perhaps the dream isnt really about john, perhaps he represents something else? Any insight would be appreciated, and sorry it was so long. Lol
comment_text: He is probably an Animus figure, or your inner masculine part. I think the feelings associated with the Animus part are what we really want to give ourselves to feel completely whole. It's unconditional love and acceptance as we are, flaws and all. He probably symbolizes that because he had such a huge crush and wanted to be around you even though you didn't feel the same for him and because the relationship was during your formative years.

comment_text: My guess is the wasps represent negative feelings or difficulty in your life that you are trying to navigate. The comment might represent criticism you are feeling from others re: how you are handling these negativities.

post_text: I had this dream and idk if it was a message or what. In the dream, my brother in law had a girl added as his sister on Facebook and he seen her in person. In the dream, I heard him tell her that she really didn’t know him well if she seen him in person. post_text: I just woke up from an odd dream. I was at my work, and had walked to my car. I saw teenagers leaning against my car. One was sitting on my car window. I came closer, he had broken my window. He looked kike he didnt give a care. I grabbed him by his shirt, made him look at the damage, and I told him, " you see what you did?! You! Are gonna pay for this damage!! Go get paper and a pen, and I want your parents number. DO YOU HEAR WHAT I SAID???". I was so raged, I was having a hard time texting my manager. I know me shouting and angry in the dream means I'm blowing off steam from waking life. What does broken window would mean?
comment_text:
Hi , i have a few suggestions for you. It could be to do with your behaviour in regards to how you move forward in life. That may or may not also have ties work and career.

Something about your teenage self is obscuring your outlook and your view is broken in some way. Think about how old the teens were in the dream and what was going on for you at that age. If it were my dream I would be looking for my own behaviours then and seeing what traits I still hold.

It may be the "I don't care" is an arrogance you hold, this could be a reactionary habit formed at that time in order to self protect.

I feel that the confrontation is about looking at yourself and confronting the issue. What has been broken within you and what is responsible for that damage? How have the events of your teenage years damaged your ability to move forward with clear sight.

I feel the need to contact the parents suggests that you would like your own parents or upbringing to take some responsability for the damage.

The manager is you and your own internal management system. It may be that you have a lot of repressed anger and rage carried forward from that time. The "I don't care" might be an attitude formed though not being able to change a situation. Sometimes if we have no agency we detratch or disassociate as it's the only option we have at the time that allows us to escape and avoid facing the emotions we have.

This is one possible interpretation.
Others might offer alternatives of course.

Last night in my dream I was house sitting for a family member. I walked to the house, which was actually a long walk, along a dirt path. Ahead of me was a deer chasing a grizzly bear. My walking speed matched their running speed.
I entered the house and started turning on lights as it was getting dark quickly. I went to the back door to find a black bear napping in what looked like a large mud room. The pets inside the house were all panicking.
I tried to secure the house but the black bear found a way in through a door I didn't know about.
I ran to the basement to find several family members watching television. When I told them a bear was in the house they panicked.
I went back upstairs, grabbed the bear by the scruff of his neck and dragged it outside.

It was all so surreal I laughed a little when I woke up.
comment_text: It could be about dealing with a problem that found its way in. Since you’re house sitting it could be you’re thinking about a family problem rather than it being your specific problem.

post_text:
Had a very vivid/weird dream last night.
Started off with being near the beach with my OH and watching large boulders being dropped into the sea, which we thought were bombs.

Next thing I know, I'm on a ship, something similar to a cargo ship. Something bad happened and we all had to evacuate, but we (the other people on the boat, not my OH as he wasn't there) missed the last flight off.

Suddenly there was ice everywhere and we were all trapped on a set of metal stairs leading up to the flight deck. It was freezing and we couldn't move. I began to sob hysterically and dropped to the floor that was icy cold.
I wanted to die and get it over with, so much that I almost jumped from the railing but was stopped by a random guy.

The rest is blurry after that. I remember being comforted, but not sure by who.

Any thoughts?
comment_text:
Hi, the dream suggests you ard trying to navigate some difficukt emotions.

There is a situation that you feel could be devastating and explosive but actually is less volatile than you imagine. Though It still causes major emotional disruption and obstacles in your life.

My thoughts are that you feel very vulnerable as you try to navigate the repercussions of this event, you would like to escape but you are unable.

I feel the ice represents frozen emotions. A feeling of being stuck and unable to find releif or release. You would like to move on or make changes but you are potentially afraid I feel. You perhaps are unable to let your true feeling be known. I wonder if this is related to yoyr relationship in some way. I feel internally you are being overwhelmed by your emotions, you want the situation to end but you feel unable to act, and this is very difficult for you. I feel the random man is your own thinking/
rational side who is trying to support you as right now the emotional side is overworked. I feel the dream calls for balance in order to find some resolution, dealing with this situation through emotions alone is exhausting you, to me it seems it's time to get some perspective, look at things in a more logical way and make some decissions based on reason as well as feelings.

post_text: I had 4 false awakenings after taking a nap today. On the 4th one, there was a woman in my living room beside me (I was asleep on the couch) and she got up and started heading to the door like she was leaving, I was like "WHO THE FUCK ARE YOU?!" And she looked at me and said "Grandma". My grandma is passed away, but she was not MY grandma and I said this. She appeared to be an old native American woman (I am also native), she didn't smile and I was immediately afraid of her. I kept trying to turn the lamp on so I could see her better. The light wouldn't turn on which made me realize it was a dream (or maybe astral projection) because lights never work in my dreams and that's how I always become lucid and know I'm dreaming. Then she said "I'm not going to let you turn the light on". I started freaking out because I couldn't wake myself up and she started attacking me. I finally forced myself awake, but I kept slipping back into the dream because I couldnt hold my eyes open, and every time I did she was still attacking me. There was someone else in the room at one point that I couldn't see, whispering "She let someone in when she was staring in the mirror", and I was screaming "WHO DID?!" but they wouldn't answer. Eventually I woke up all the way, but does anyone know what this could mean?
comment_text:
As I see it, she represents two things, one being ancestral trauma pertaining to your grandmother. When she says she won't let you turn the light on, that's shadow-speak for "I won't let you kill me" as "shadow-work" is about shedding Divine Light on trauma shadows to "heal" them. Traumas hide in the shadows, they are the shadows..

Find out a bit about her younger days for specific traumas. If there aren't any major traumas you can identify then she could be representing "Anchorages" into old Feminine psyche, old Feminine values, old Feminine energies that you're growing out of as a natural part of life.

Either way, the shadows we shed Light on and grow out of, feel we're attacking and murdering them so they "attack" us and scare us but they can't actually do anything besides creating fear which they then latch on to and survive through. They're just shadows, they work through perception, illusion, "Magic".

My suggestion would be energy cleansing using Earthing/
Grounding and increasing water intake (I always suggest these two for a smoother ascension as we're all experiencing ascension symptoms globally).

I'd highly recommend the scents of rose, jasmine, and sandalwood around you.

Send healing and love to the vision you saw. She told you she was your grandmother so you'd know the thread that connects her to you, so you'd know whom to send Love and Light to.

Focus on strengthening your Heart Chakra. All Chakras spin and as they spin they "cleanse". Cleansing is transmuting because energy doesn't go anywhere it transmutes into other forms of energy.

When we divert focus to the Chakras during meditation, they are energized. Energized Chakras cleanse better even on autopilot ie when you're not meditating.

Cleansed Chakras mean stronger spiritual boundaries which means greater "protection".

post_text: Okay this one might be a little everywhere. So it started out as me figuring out that my “best friend” in the dream was talking to my boyfriend of almost three years. I’m always either super angry or crying hysterically, this time I was crying hysterically. So when they decided to meet up I went outside and sat in his car with him just to never get answers. (In any dream he cheats I never get answers or it’s always my fault) so after I get no answers and leave, someone’s driving to my house and I’m crying really bad and I look in the back seat to like the “dream best friend” and I ask her how could she do this knowing me and him been together for three years! And I started smacking tf out of her. We get to my house and my brother falls for her the same brother that said me dating someone older is bad for the family (and he has a controlling gf) and there he is trying to get with someone younger that has the same age gap. Then I starting screaming and popping off to my brother saying like tf how is he gonna be so hypocritical! And one part of the dream I remember is calling my boyfriends phone and a girl￼ picks up and I tell her she better find my boyfriend before I drive up to his town my self and she found him and he headed to my house ig to talk but he never tells me why he did it in my dreams unless it’s blaming me. The rest of the dream was me following my boyfriend around to get answers because he’s always running, or always finding a way out of it.
comment_text: Ooof, dreams like that really eff up your day afterwards…To me this sounds like a fear of loss or betrayal. Since it deals with several people I’d say you might be feeling disconnected from your loved ones, which could contribute to fears of being blindsided or betrayed. Maybe communication isn’t as open or frequent as you desire, or on the flip side this can happen from the opposite. When things are going realllly well we tend to think “ok, where’s the catch? what could threaten this good thing I’ve got going?”. I’d say you should take a day with each person involved. Plan some fun actives, or just hang out and talk. Confiding in each other about your lives, worries, and feelings might restore the sense of security and trust. Take a little time and mull over the events, patterns, or fears that could be making you feel far away from the people you love. Could be as simple as not having adequate time to catch up with people and maintain that feeling of an intimate connection. Good luck, I hope you feel better soon 💕

post_text:
I am in an underground activity, like an escape room but on a larger scale, like a labyrinth. There are lots of people walking around trying to find the way out, but getting nowhere. One of them is an old dancing partner when I was taking ballroom dancing lessons.

I get the impression of a long time searching for the proper path.

The focus of the dream is when I come to an old temple, Ancient Greek-ish with a large granite statue, specifically granite with a rustic pinkish hue.

Looking up into the temple roof I realise no one is up there and it dawns on me that the path is likely up there as no one down here has found the way, so I head up there.

The dream then goes to an out of body view of the path. There is an above ground bridge like structure, and the way corkscrews as a tunnel around it. Because its a tunnel everyone assumes its underground, but it isn't, its not logical. That's the trick.
comment_text: This dream represents your life. You and others are in this labyrinth which represents a safe place but also a trap sort of. If you want to play it safe in life you are stuck in the labyrinth. You are searching for a way out and the temple you realize is the way out. The knowledge from the past gives you the opportunity to learn more about your path forward in life. You see beyond the labyrinth. That it's really an illusion. The true path is finding a way to be above it all. To not stay down in the labyrinth. To take the higher road is the answer.

post_text:
I am in an underground activity, like an escape room but on a larger scale, like a labyrinth. There are lots of people walking around trying to find the way out, but getting nowhere. One of them is an old dancing partner when I was taking ballroom dancing lessons.

I get the impression of a long time searching for the proper path.

The focus of the dream is when I come to an old temple, Ancient Greek-ish with a large granite statue, specifically granite with a rustic pinkish hue.

Looking up into the temple roof I realise no one is up there and it dawns on me that the path is likely up there as no one down here has found the way, so I head up there.

The dream then goes to an out of body view of the path. There is an above ground bridge like structure, and the way corkscrews as a tunnel around it. Because its a tunnel everyone assumes its underground, but it isn't, its not logical. That's the trick.
comment_text:
The subconscious here in the subterranean can mean both the shadow or unexplored self, which turns into impulse if we are not aware of it, and also the subsistence level mindset or even a survivalist mindset, where we react to life instead of choosing things in life. This happens if we have a bunch of unresolved issues or trauma that bogs us down, and we find ourselves defensive or triggered often by daily occurences, we cannot respond to these with openness or full responsiveness,
because we have shut ourselves down due to the fight, flight or freeze reaction. (I more and more think that the key to unconscious/
consciousness exploration is linked with parasympathetic
nervous system response. And that neuroscience is finding out what religion has said for a long time - that love is consciousness, the higher path, awareness.... it is only when we feel the safety of being loved that we can actually open our awareness with our higher faculties...)

And so many are stuck in this trap. Or puzzle or maze like an escape room. It is like a trap, because interestingly, we cannot truly figure out this unconscious reactivity this defensive triggered survival mode while we are actually in it. Neuroscience is saying this too. That you feel safe again first. THEN look at understanding the trigger.

But first, get out of the hole you are in, to see from a wider perspective.

Often, we get trapped in the survivalist mode because we try to figure it out from within that survivalist mode. For example, someone who feels triggered by another's behaviour might then identify that behaviour as the cause of the trigger. But this doesn't actually go very far in understanding, overcoming, or resolution. It merely cements the knowledge that the world is unsafe and that we have to have our defenses up instead of trying to find common ground.

The tunnels I think are a metaphor similar to the "trances" they often talk about in the new age (and sometimes psychology). The auto pilot mode, that is living unconsciously, without conscious awareness and choice making.

"Tunnel vision" is seeing only the narrowest path in front of you and no way out. This can be like depression "a long dark tunnel". Tunneling into something also in a more positive way can be about obsessive focus on figuring out the originating path of some particular behavioural pattern. Sometimes I think we do have to delve deeply into an obsessive thought on a specific topic in order to understand that pattern in our life. But, as in your dream, the idea is to recall you are not just in a negative obsessive circular thought pattern. But that instead you are "tunneling" up and out, in order to find the secret way to unlock this particular unconscious behavioural pattern, to crack the code, to be able to stop unconsciously repeating it.

I'll come back to the temple and the statue...

"I was never good at that dance anyway, I gave it up when I had a family"

The defensive survivalist mode was never appealing for you to be stuck in, and having a family moved you further out of that.

Which makes sense to me. To consciously choose to have a family, it requires a huuuuuggggee amount of hope and faith and optimism. AND a longer view. AND a broader understanding of the self, knowing that the lower self for example immediate needs is not the whole self, which allows one to have more patience and delayed gratification, more giving. Because you can think of not just the immediate self, but also the past and future selves, a very expansive view of self that takes us out of immediate reactivity and makes us look at a wider overview.

Also though, the larger view of self and how that links with starting a family is the selfless love of having a family. That our wellbeing is now so palpably connected to ensuring the wellbeing of our family. It is a reminder we are not just alone, selfishness is very very narrow of a view. People are quite interconnected,
whether we can see that overview or not.

post_text:
I am in an underground activity, like an escape room but on a larger scale, like a labyrinth. There are lots of people walking around trying to find the way out, but getting nowhere. One of them is an old dancing partner when I was taking ballroom dancing lessons.

I get the impression of a long time searching for the proper path.

The focus of the dream is when I come to an old temple, Ancient Greek-ish with a large granite statue, specifically granite with a rustic pinkish hue.

Looking up into the temple roof I realise no one is up there and it dawns on me that the path is likely up there as no one down here has found the way, so I head up there.

The dream then goes to an out of body view of the path. There is an above ground bridge like structure, and the way corkscrews as a tunnel around it. Because its a tunnel everyone assumes its underground, but it isn't, its not logical. That's the trick.
comment_text:
Greek temple and statue could be Agape love.

Pink is often a sign of love. And the unnamed god is "openhanded"

Agape love, universal love, what is termed also "christian charity", selfless love, a larger view of self, caring for others, "gods love"...

As I said above, I think neuroscience (for example Stephen Porges polyvagal theory) is just telling us now what ancient religion and philosophy has also said. Agape love is the answer to consciousness. Giving it and receiving it opens the pathways.

Pathways here also are figurative, as in changing behavioural patterns in life through increasing overview and wider awareness. But also literal - opening and strengthening new pathways in the brain to form connections that used to be dead ends or circular thought patterns before.

Agape love, which I think is necessary in consciously starting a family, is linked with hope, faith, optimism, and it is definitely the guiding philosophical principle which can improve life for oneself and others 💙

post_text:
*graphic natured dream*

Okay so I only remember bits and pieces… but why would I dream I accidentally killed someone??? 😳😳😳 I remember my brother (he has stolen from me and everyone in the past) but he was in my room with the light off and I caught him and we were arguing and he said he was going to tell my boyfriend I was cheating on him, then I can remember my ex at my door with my younger brother. Well in the doorway my other brother (the one in my room) tried to choke me and I pushed him he fell off my porch but then completely changed from my dark head brother to some unknown blonde guy. His neck was broken and he was dead. I was screaming it was an accident, I was hysterically crying. Thank God I woke up fast from that horrible dream, but what the hell????
comment_text:
Unresolved issues with your brother are probably contributing. Your mind may have been trying to tell you that you need to cut him out of your life, or let it go. The reason he may have changed to a different person in the end could be that you don't really want to hurt your brother at all, just the part of him that is doing bad and irresponsible things. That person could represent someone who has influenced or encouraged his negative behaviors in the past.

I'm so sorry you had such a horrible dream. It's scary when your subconscious shows you images you would never actually do in real life, but remember our dreams typically are not literal. It's all imagery and symbolism interpreted from memories and experiences in our past. I hope your dreams are better from now on. 💚

post_text: Hello! I am seeking insight into my dream. I dreamt that it was night. I was sitting on the passenger side of a vehicle that was parked in front of a house that was recently purchased by someone I knew in my dream. It appeared to be a really nice move-in ready home, however, upon close examination, I could tell that the home was not habitable. The roof was incomplete as I could still see its trusses. It was evident that the home had been assembled quickly without regard. There was a non-occupant vehicle parked next to the vehicle that I was in. Despite the vehicle being new, there were visible scratches. Suddenly, the vehicle that I was in started to roll backwards. I struggled to stop the vehicle, but managed to figure it just moments prior to it rolling in the street . The vehicle's interior was quiet unique, and not at all what I am accustomed to. I couldn't figure out how to drive the vehicle forward towards the house. My husband came along to explain a few things about the vehicle. The dream changed and I was now sitting in the rear. There was a woman sitting in the driver's seat. Without warning the woman transformed into a dark green lizard. I was so frightened that I ran out of the vehicle. I started swimming through the air (a common occurrence in my dreams). Afraid that someone would see me, I sought-after a place that I could swim through the air without being seen.
comment_text: It seems in this dream that you are out of your league. You have a car that you don't understand how to drive. You have a house that you can't live in. You are trying to do too much. This dream is saying to slow down and not get ahead of yourself.

post_text:
Warning…poop and fire.

This one woke me up crying.
I walk into my house, to numerous cat poops on the floor, but they are all on fire. (Orange flames) But instead of putting out the fire, I walk past. I realize that there are also cat toys on fire too. There are two kittens, but it seems that everything they touch is becoming enflamed. One of the cats bats a toy my way and suddenly it’s on fire. One of the cats is playing under a coffee table and the toy/carpet is on fire so much it singes her fur! I grab the cat and cry because she’s singed but it doesn’t seem hurt then. I tell the other person the cats are setting things on fire, as they seem unaware. They snap back at me and then me: “it’s YOUR cat setting everything on fire!!!”
I quickly realize that somehow they set a couch on fire, mainly the arm of the couch. The foam inside is smoldering. I run to get a bucket, but the first one is broken. The next one is full of dirty water, so I try and flush it down the toilet but it goes everywhere and the bucket proceeds to break too. I run to the kitchen to get a large cup just to slow the smoldering. But the water pressure is low and it’s taking forever. I fill the cup as much as I can and run to extinguish the fire. I keep going back for more water, and eventually find that the foam is smoldering near the floor, so I focus my attention there. Soon the foam reaches the floor/carpet and starts to set it on fire too. Now I’m aiming at the floor, as the smoldering has turned to actual fire. The floor becomes completely engulfed in flames and I can’t do anything except watch the flames crawl across the floor and up the wall. *wake up crying*
comment_text: Hi Tracey, I am wondering if emotionally you are feeling out of control. You could be feeling detached from something or even yourself. At the start of the dream you don’t seem to be in control but then later on in your dream you seem to wake up and take action but this then shows you could be feeling overwhelmed about something. You could also be feeling consumed by something, this could be with sadness which could result in a lack of motivation which was shown at the beginning. Your dream does seem to show you trying to heal and I think you need to give yourself time to be able to do this. At the start your cats are playing and want you to play with them, this could be showing the need to be able to let go of things and to focus on doing things where you can have fun instead of worrying about what others think.

post_text:
In the dream, I bought a house. I was in a different country, though I don’t know which ones. From the outside, it seemed tiny, dainty. Inside it was beautiful. Each floor was very small, painted lavender, and there were maybe about seven stories. Like my own personal tower. The rooms were full of furniture from the previous owner.

It started off amazing. Me, my mother (my mother lives in another country) and my best friend and her husband were cleaning the place out. I was keeping the furniture I did want, giving away others. One the rooms was a children’s room, with a small bed and a crib, both made of golden coloured metal. I gave the crib to my friend, as in my dream she was either newly pregnant or trying for a baby. As we were emptying that room, someone got a call that a local boy had been kicked out of his house by his awful father. We all knew of him. I told her to tell the kid he could stay here, in this room until he could go home or figure something out.

The boy never showed up in the dream, but somewhere around that conversation is when things started to go wrong.

My friend took a shower and saw someone looking at her from the drain. We checked every drain, and every drain in the house had someone looking through it. Like all you could see was the eyeball, looking up. The floorboards were suddenly rotten, they looked fine, but I’d step on them and they’d start to collapse down. I fell through the floor and into the basement of the house.

I contacted an insurance agent, and when I explained the issues he started to laugh, hysterically. Then that scene disappeared and suddenly I was someone else, a teen girl, trying desperately to pretend I went to a school I know I didn’t, trying to get this group of people to let me go somewhere with them. And not in the way of a teen just wanting to be included, they were doing something dangerous or bad and this girl, for some reason, needed to gain their trust, have them underestimate her, so she could find out what it was. It felt like her life depended on it. They ended up letting her tag along, but I woke up as soon as they started to walk away with her.

I don’t dream too often, and when I do they’re always so strange and I can never make sense of them, but this one left me a little freaked out.
comment_text:
The house represents you I think, and doing a self spring clean, going through changes.

The seven stories are particularly interesting if you know anything about the chakras...

I think the rejected boy being adopted represents integrating your own rejected masculine traits but in so doing creates personal chaos as the person you wete comfortable as starts to fall apart and deteriorate. I read it as you becoming uncomfortable as you go through these changes, perhaps feel you were not quite as great as you previously considered perhaps.

I think thats why you become a teemage girl, a period of time of self discovery, going through a new "coming of age" process.

Really crazy night for me last night. 3 painful dreams / nightmares maybe :

1. My father got horrible rashes (scallops sized 4-5 acne on his face) and sick and not able to participate and enjoy during family festivities. I am somehow away from him and miss him and couple days later he posts on FB his rashes healed but he lost unhealthy amount of weight and wearing ugly clothes.

Really trying hard to be able to open my eyes and putting lots of effort and finally able to open for few seconds before it closed off again. And those few seconds saw some cop cars in front of me not behind. Somehow I know I am on a narrow freeway and put lots of effort to be able to pull over. Then panicking what if I have hit a person and then they might have been hurt or died and I don’t know about it.

3. I am in home of some actress I don’t care about and they are leading a normal life. I am just there and it doesn’t make sense but they are not bothering me or interacting with me but I am somewhat comfy and exploring. Later someone in their home want to take their dogs on a walk 5-6 aggressive dogs and the dogs are on a leash but the person take a pair of scissors and cut off the leash. The dreams see to be about how uncomfortable you feel. Your father could be representing that you don’t feel self confident, and this isn’t a healthy situation; you’re not nourishing yourself.
You’re feeling trapped and don’t know what to do, can’t see the way forward. You need to pull over and find out what’s going on, think about what you’re doing and where you’re going.
The aggressive dogs could represent some criticisms that you are afraid of and want to retreat to safety. Maybe your car is safe because you can shut out everything there.

Anyways last night I had a dream and The dream was
I wake up and go to my son to get him out of his crib and he has scratches all over his tummy and back and I freak out send a video to my hubby .I go sit on the bed with him and I remember just being so scared in the room. We wind up at some hotel and it’s me and my sisters and hubby and we all just hanging out and I ask him if he has watched the video he hasn’t that he left his phone and I tell him about it and he doest take it serious so I try to leave and I’m in the parking lot and my car is next to another vehicle and it has a walker in between it I assume it was my great grandma because she used a walker ( she has recently passed )
I open the door slightly and turn the key and then go to passenger side to get in when I noticed my fiancé turn off the car and say your not leaving . Some more stuff happened the scene changed I was at my grandma house in the backyard and the fish was jumping out the water . I often dream about the pond of my grandparents backyard but I don’t think it has to much meaning in this dream . ￼

Honestly it could be me just overthinking so much that I’m having dreams about it but I hope he’s okay and if anyone can let me know if their is a meaning to this dream that would be great.
comment_text:
In my opinion all dreams have meaning, but being a symbolic message they can be really odd.

My suspicion is that the dream characters are symbols of aspects of yourself and not about those people external to you in waking.

In that context I'd see your child as either an inner child aspect or maybe, and I think given the scene with the car as a symbol of the personal journey this is how I would lean, that he is a symbol of your personal development (the new version if you that has come out of you).

Your partner I think is representing your intellect (masculine as thinking vs feminine as feeling). So I would see this as saying your innrr child or developing self has been attacked but you don't understand how or why, and are intellectually refusing to contemplate it.

And in that refusal you are as a result also refusing to continue your journey (not driving).

I think the walker might be tied to that too, like you have the option to engage your analytucal mind and figure what is causing this issue and resolve the problem at its root, or you can stop your personal growth journey, put up with the symptoms (walker as a support dealing with being in a disabled state).

Thats not the only way to look at these symbols though, just how I see the dream patterns.

post_text:
Rough drawing attached for reference below!

Last night I dreamt a typical, nondescript dream, but then my dream was interrupted. It quite literally felt like someone had hacked my brain with an extremely realistic and vivid video that was being broadcast; it almost felt like a subliminal message being flashed quickly. It was a dark forest at night as I faced a line of trees, presumably the edge of a forest. A metal sign hung from the middle tree in front of me that had the feeling of a No Tresspassing sign. Besides the illegible text at the top, there was an all-seeing eye right in the middle. Suddenly red and blue lights flashed behind it alternatively, like cop car lights, VIVIDLY and almost neon and overly saturated. Fog started rolling out behind the sign from the lights, and the “video” started zooming in slowly towards the sign while rotating. The focus was always on the sign. After that, I returned to my nondescript dream that I was in prior to that.

It very much felt like someone had hacked my dream to show me this scene, like an urgent message. It didn’t feel like I personally was there, rather that someone had filmed it objectively with the intention of sending it to me.

l somewhat understand the significance of the forest and the eye, but what I can’t wrap my head around, is the feeling that someone or something intervened in my dream to show me this bizarre image. It felt like it was warning me of something, neither good nor bad, just that it was urgent. I’ve never experienced this sensation of my dream being taken over like a breaking news broadcast before.
comment_text: Well they are talking about putting ads in dreams which is why I'm suddenly keen on lucid dreaming so I can click the skip ads box.

post_text:
Reoccurring dream help needed please and thanks! ￼

Topics: Dorm, pets, plane, family and packing ALL important belongings.

Hello I have been having a lot of dreams about college. I never went to a university or dorm of any sort.

Dream: packing up my dorm room trying to make sure I have all of my stuff because Once leave I can’t go back. In previous dreams I can never get everything packed to fit in my bags and take with me. last night I had family helping. my (divorced sense I was age 1) mom and dad helped. My dad drove out to wherever I was to put big things that wouldn’t fit on plane In his tiny car. My mom flew out to help. once we were ready to get on plane to head home my kids and cat showed up. I watched as they all buckled up and got ready for take off. But I was outside the window/door watching. I ended up missing the flight as it took off I was panicked. Not for me for my mom because she would be worried about me left alone in an unfamiliar place so late at night￼. I told her I’m ok I’ll catch the next one that was coming at 3 am. No biggie. ITS Ok! IM OK! is what I was yelling to her as the plane took off. The people in the airport looked worried for me till i said no I’m good I’m worried about her worrying. Then all the sudden I’m back in dorm room packing with my dad. He had helped take all the pictures of loved ones and special things down off the walls. We had almost everything packed up he was fitting my king size bed in his tiny car along with other large objects. I was just going to ride home with him I though why wait for the next plane. He said he was going to come back Monday and buy a pice of furniture I was leaving behind and even though I wanted the piece still I was like ok my loss his gain. He’s helping that’s what’s right I’ll find a new one. Then all the sudden he was gone and one of my kids was with me. we were packing anything else we could find before the next plane came. Odd thing here was we were packing purses and other to go bags into our bag to bring. Once I was on the plane my kid turned into one of my dogs and our other dog was outside the plane barking and now it was snowing. I looked out the window saw her and told the people not to take off. They opened the planes long back hatch like on a military plane to let her in and she came running up. I could feel the coldness coming from her. then i watched the snow melting once she sat next to me and I could feel the warmth of her snuggle. Then we were ready to take off but I told them I had to pee before the plane took off. The flight attendant was not happy bc I did the same thing last time before the plane almost took off. Turns out I had to pee for real so I got up and that was my dream.

Normally I can’t find my ticket or lose track of time is why I miss plane. I also never have helpers or get packed up as far as I did last night. The only thing that was holding me up from taking off this time was my bladder. The one time I did take off on the plane in the dream the windows were open and my pets were all stuffed in a crumbling cage bc they had to be in cages to be on the plane. This dream last night they were allowed on with leashes or without like
Mine that almost got left behind. I saw people get on with their dogs and they each had a dog leash on one red one blue. ￼

Thanks In advance for any input￼ and for sticking with me I know I have horrible spelling and grammar issues. 💟💡
comment_text: Hello, the dorm could be about independence as college is a time in life when you move away from the support of family to live on your own and make your own decisions. It can also be about some learning from life experiences that you were reflecting on.You have support of your parents in the dream but they can be representing your rational (dad) and emotional (mom) sides. You seem to be quite capable on your own and more worried about taking care of others than worried about yourself. Plane trips can represent life aspirations or spiritual journeys. With your daughter being almost left behind, left out in the cold and then feeling her warmth and having to pee it would seem you may have some feelings or worries about her growing independence that you dislike. She could also be representing an aspect of you and indicating that deep down you really do have some tentative feelings about your situation yet you seem to regain your center easily with the knowledge your family is there for you and you for them.

post_text:
I am walking to a corner coffee shop.
Along the way, I see a beautiful historic home and walk up to the back door. I peek inside a window and am impressed with what I see. Like Goldilocks, I go in the house, uninvited.

It is quirky, wide plank wood floors, built in cabinets, shelves, nooks and crannies with all sorts of antique collectibles, fireplaces in every room. The kitchen has copper pots and pans hanging from a metal rack. The entire house is a showcase.

There are children’s books open and strewn all over the living room floor. A narrow, steep staircase that leads to the second floor. I go upstairs and explore a bit. In a drawer I see some colored pieces of metal that look kind of like skinny bullets.

I leave the house and pass a couple with their two children on my way to the coffee shop. While I’m there, they come back to announce that someone has been in their house and stolen something.

They approach me and accuse me, but I don’t remember taking anything. I reach into my pocket and there are two of the metal pegs, one green, one gold.

I am scolded, and worry that I’ll be arrested. But, the man gets some kind of device and tells me he wants to show me something. The device looks like a juicer. He places the gold peg into a hole in the top and it squeezes out into a small pillow shape of soft foam.

I try to leave while people are distracted, but just then, my real life employer (who happens to be the cook at the cafe) says that she found a note that I wrote. She reads it out loud.

It says something about not being sorry for my actions and that if I hadn’t gotten caught, no one would be the wiser.

Just then I wake up.
comment_text: Has anything happened at your work where you feel justified in what action you took?

As water level was rising and me and my family was still on 1st floor, I rushed in the rooms and try calling my father to come and go to upper level (my house has total ground, 1st, 2nd and 3rd level as a roof (accessible)) and I started collecting warm clothes, blanket with me to take to another level. But when I came out of the room, I saw water level gone down a bit (like 40%) and the current 1st level floor was safe and now there was no need to go to next level. Then, I saw the family and the guy (who successfully took out and jumped on the tip of other's house roof, mentioned earlier) in the balcony of same other's house.

Note: in real life, the other's house that I see and the house I was in are both real in real life. Others house is my neighbour s house. The family I saw is known and real except that girl that I hurt in the dream
comment_text: This house represents you and how your life is going. The water represents your emotions that you are going through. Rising and falling according to your own struggles. Going down 40% is a positive sign. This to me reflects your relationships with your father especially and other people. Maybe neighbor or acquaintances.

post_text:
Okay so, has anyone had a dream of a horse that looks like this?

I believe the breed could be (Appaloosa or knabstrupper cross paint)

Anyway the horse kind of looked like this but had paint markings on him/her too.

When I saw this horse in my dream I was so mesmerised by their beauty.

Funnily enough, I went to look at a horse today and I’m going to be adopting her from a rescue (she’s not the same colour, she’s flea bitten grey).

I’m so intrigued to know what this dream means. I hope somebody can decipher it for me please?
comment_text:
Nękø Nightfall this looks to me like Pippi Longstocking's horse, Old Man.

While she would ride the horse, she would also carry him, because she was extraordinarily
strong.

If you know this story, I wonder if it has any relevance as a symbol for your dream

Adopting a horse for your rescue for example, might be about how you are rediscovering your childlike sense of wonder and adventure and extraordinary strength, by "carrying" this horse - by taking care of an animal, that traditionally, is considered to be of service to humans for farming or carrying humans. Instead, you will be taking care of and tending this horse.

If the horse is "retired" then the name of Pippis horse "old man" might be relevant

Horse - (and Pippi!) - keyword I think of is strength.

Oh I just noticed paint markings were on your dream horse - yes, in Pippi, the spots were painted on lol I do seem to recall that...

To have spots painted on, in this rescue horse scenario might be that the "negative marks against this horse" are superficial and artificial. "Painted on" as in falsified, the "black marks" against adopting this animal are not truly valid.

Possibly also there is a saying of being "unable to change one's spots (or stripes)" meaning that we cannot change who we are, who we appear to be, cannot change our nature.

This horse, however, it seems like it CAN change it's spots lol it can change its nature

Spots can also be a pun, if for example when you adopt the animal you will change its location. It might be the feeling that if you adopt it and change it's location, the negative marks on it's character are going to change

Horse... strength, speed, power... being burdened or saddled with responsibility or work, can also be about freedom if unsaddled, if it has blinkers on it could be about blindspot you have.

A bridle can be a pun for a wedding, and commitment

Wild horse can be a free spirit

post_text:
First of all, thanks for the add, which was a few weeks ago but I’m just finally getting to why I joined.
I usually can figure out my dreams pretty well, but for about almost 3 weeks straight, I had dreams of people. Just people. People with faces and bodies that I’ve never met. Each night was different, but with more people, more strange faces. I think Mercury was in my ruling planet of Neptune at the time. A lot of planetary and sun flare involvement too.
Most of the time I was just a witness, other times, I was saying something, but those parts I cannot remember.
My first impression was that it was people of Ukraine. Although I was watching the news on occasion, I made it a point to stay away from all forms of news just to see if my dreams would change. It didn’t help.
Now, years ago when a Tsunami hit Sri Lanka, I had dreamed of being on a beach and running to get a mom and child off because they were playing and not noticing the wave coming. We didn’t make if off but I was holding them and sort of flying. And there were many flocks of birds and we were all going in the same direction. When I woke up, my husband was reading the newspaper and tells me a tsunami hit …. I think my heart went to my feet and he saw my expression and got concerned. Yes, I believe I was there and helping people pass, but all I have is terms I’ve read, “Lightworker”.

This dream is not close to that, but seeing people, helping them is. I can’t help feel the confusion. The more I tried to stay in the dream and try to figure it out, the more I just kept repeating the same part.

Feelings?
comment_text: Could be that you are an empath and a healer. Hard to say from the dream but it seems you know that you clue into situations where healing is needed.

post_text:
Ok last night I had a strange dream. i was downstairs watching tele with my daughter (baby) and suddenly at the back of tele, a fire starts and it spreads quickly. I grab my daughter but bang my leg on the cabinet as I turn and then I go to run out the house. As I’m running out the house with my daughter in my arms, I call the dog and dog runs out with us and the fire also quickly follows behind us.
I’m assuming we was only ones in the house as I didn’t see my other children or my mother/brother who we also live with.
I try to call 999 but I keep calling 969 instead by accident. My neighbour appears at their door and runs in to get their phone.
I very abruptly wake up from this dream and my face is boiling like I’ve really just been there and I have a injury on the leg that I injured in my dream.
What on earth does this dream mean?
comment_text: If you were having a hot flush in your sleep, it could translate to a dream about fire or anger (spoken from experience when I had rosacea) but your face feeling hot could also be a result of the dream. Fire in dreams can represent anger. In this case perhaps something you observed caused it. You had problems communicating about it. Injuring your leg might mean you get your ability to move on from it was compromised.

post_text: I went to an appt complex hallway and knocked on someone’s door; I’m pretty sure it was a guy I knew while I was younger who gave me the middle finger as he drove by in a truck in a recent dream. I was talking to him then something he said made me ask him, “what did you do?” I remember feeling like he was talking about me, but he tried to hide it. Then I realized the apartment complex is in poor condition, inside the apartment looks like a messy hoarder situation, and then I noticed several feral cats. I should’ve tried to help get the guy out, but I was primarily concerned about my safety, so I was cautiously trying to walk towards either the front door or back door (whatever felt safer). I woke up before I left because my brain doesn’t let me get harmed, and I woke up with a panic attack or at least anxiety. I do feel like I know who the person was, but I want to mention that I rarely ever know or feel any connection with anyone in my dreams (it’s usually like people are around, but they don’t feel real). I can’t accurately say if I’m right about who it is or any feelings associated with the person because I had to calm myself down and remind myself that I’m protected.
comment_text:
Apartments in dreams can be like a mindset of your that you view as not really authentically you, like you don't take full ownership of it. The guy can be representing something you did (you asking him "what did you do?" ) and so the interior of the apartment is a reflection of how you feel about whatever that was. Hence you feel you are kind of a mess and the feral cats might be some cattiness that felt out of control or unlike you. Cats can also represent female sexuality, introversion or intuition among other things. The fact they are feral in the dream suggests you were judging yourself for not attending to them and letting your more animalistic urges run free. Basically, I think you woke up with anxiety because there was some situation in your life that you think you should have behaved differently but we are often our harshest critics so perhaps the dream is indicating to give yourself the compassion/
help you thought you should show the guy in the dream. This is how I read the dream but there can be many interpretations
so if this doesn't resonate look for others' responses.

post_text: So I had a dream I was in the passenger seat of a car going up a road like this, like 95% vertical climb, I woke up when we reached the top. Any suggestions what it might mean?????
comment_text:
Adding to Terry Dey that allowing yourself to "go with the flow" "enjoy the ride" "be carried along by someone else's energy" is going to help you to overcome this obstacle.

If you are also the driver, as some dream interpretations
suggest, it is your intense focus and drive that will get you over obstacle, but it has to paired with a go with the flow attitude as well, this balance will do it.

Otherwise, it is someone in your life that you are offering counterpoint to - their intense drive, and your going with the flow, this is having success against all odds.

I think of also the idea of a "steep incline"

Inclination - can mean a desire or character habit. Is there something that you are VERY much not normally inclined to do (you are only 5% inclined to do this) and yet you are having success because of your intense drive to do it, paired with your going with the flow, possibly allowing others to take the main lead?

Hope you are well Aram Sarian your dreams are often lovely in their spiritually resonant symbolic nature

post_text:
Posting anonymous for protection.
I was sexually abused by my uncle back in 2011 he served time in prison and was released by 2015. Never heard from him since, neither has anyone in the family. Not had a bad dream or flashback etc since then either.
Last night I woke suddenly at around 3:30 from a horrible dream.
I had my cousin round (uncles daughter) my home and what I believe must be her new boyfriend. I knew it was a male that was with her but didn’t see his face. Then there was a knock at the door so I’ve gone to open it and a older man has barged past me and gone straight into my front room. I’ve followed to 1- see who they are and 2- see what on earth there doing.
It’s my uncle who abused me going to talk to his daughter, he was shouting a lot but I couldn’t understand what about. He was trying to get her to leave with him but she started crying and ran out the house and the male ran out after her. This left me and my uncle alone. He started having ago at me and how I sent him down after he begged me not to and that he would of just left and not spoke to me again. I tried to get run out and got to the hallway but he grabbed me by my arm and pushed me into my bedroom. He pushed me onto the bed and then he had a saw just waving it about. He was muttering and pacing back and forth in front of the door. There was a bang by the front door opening and then a gun shot and then I woke up.
Can someone try and figure this out for me please as it’s really triggered me and I’ve spent the past few hours googling what it means but failing.
comment_text:
The house as consciousness, I'm wondering if something has happened to soneone else that has made your past experiences intrude into your conscious awareness?

I'm not sure, but the saw seems significant, maybe this experience, symbolised by him, is threatening or in the act of immobilising you (thrown to bed and assuming the saw as neing to remove limbs, limbs being symbols of takung action). It could also be a play on words linking to what you "saw"?

The daughter could be a symbol for someone who can "relate" to this experience hence may not be a family member? In fact she could even be a symbol of part of your character, perhaps unwanted or aggressive advances being shot down because of your past experiences? Not necessarily forced but even just moving too fast as dreams can exagerate?

Keep in mind these are just some ideas of top of my head and may not resonate, could certainly be seen in different ways.

post_text:
Hi, I’m just wondering if somebody could interpret this dream for me. (I’d like to also add that I’ve never left the country or gone to USA and i have never spoken to this lady)

I dreamt of going to the USA to visit this lady off a page I follow. I don’t know how I got there because I didn’t have a passport, and mind me I’d just woken up and I was there. I remember having a coronary about the fact that my mum would freak If she knew I was in a completely different country.

But anyway, I was there with this lady and we’re chatting (I can’t remember what we were talking about though). After that I was back at this place I was supposed to be staying at and I remember talking to the people who were in the house. I was saying that I don’t know how I got there without a passport and not sure how I’ll get back either. Then a lady replied with I don’t care then all of a sudden a memory appeared in my head of being at the airport but they hadn’t even asked for my passport and let me through.

I don’t remember how but all this stuff we have here was at this place I was staying at and I saw these two cats that looked exactly like mine. I was worried that they were my cats and how I was gonna take them back along with this Ute and all the rest of it.

So In the next part of this dream I was with the lady again and we were travelling back via MK II Oppressors (futuristic bike that can hover and fly). We travelled back through some mountains and remember seeing these people and all this secret stuff happening. We hid so they couldn’t see us and when they left I noticed diamonds. After that we continued on our trip back to Australia and that was it.
comment_text:
How I read it really depends on this lady, and how you feel about the passport. It seems to center about you being somewhere you don't really belong I think? Particularly uncertain how you even ended up there, like as if you had been in a trance or something.

Uncertainty about how to get back to a proper or true identity, or at least where you feel you belong?

Perhaps the dream suggests that a future individual journey (bike, for one rider) but influenced by perhaps a muse or inspiration can reveal the hidden/secret goings on (the unconscious forces) that drew you to this state. Looks like your work might be cut out for you too (overcoming mountains).

A lot like Dorothy and the wizard of Oz story actually.

post_text:
So I had this dream today about old friends (BFFs) in the village I used to live in Mexico when I was a teenager.

I was there for vacations, in my old house (now sold in real life because the area it was in became too polluted). But my house was also my high-school (which were nowhere near in real life). And I was hiding in my mother's room because I was depressed and wanted nothing to do with school. But I was still a teenager and my partners were still at school. Except my best friend Johnpi, who joined me in my mother's room to investigate... a murder. He needed a calm place to do that, so he skipped school. And he appreciated my help. He asked our classroom's nerd (who wasn't actually the classroom nerd in real-life) to give us copy in the math homework and she agreed. The whole classroom was very supportive of our endeavour, unlike in real-life. To skip gym class, the guys pretended to fall and get hurt to keep the teacher busy so she would not notice our absense. Oh, and this teacher was both the math and the gym teacher, in real life she was a literature teacher I had in university.

Fast-forwards, my mother complained I didn't go out enough, and that I should. I was depressed and didn't want to go anywhere, but said I would go out if my other best friend Angel agreed to meet with me. So I called him, told him I was in town, and asked if he would like to meet. He very excitingly accepted. "Great! Should I bring something?" I asked, excited too now, wondering if I should bring my Switch so we could play Pokemon.

Then I woke up. I neither solved the murder nor got to see Angel. But I still had a happy feeling.
comment_text: I wonder if this is in relation to avoiding some lesson from your past (hiding from the teacher in school)? Perhaps in relation to something related to social interactions? Maybe around reciprocated feelings and others mirroring your feelings and vice versa, and that in relation to feelings of isolation?

post_text:
Hi, thank you for the add!

A little backstory. I take care of my little brother, but we have been having a lot of behavioral issues with him at home and school, he also does not respect me or my husband.

Last night I had a dream, and we were at the house and decided we needed to go to the store for a couple things, I caught my brother leaving the door unlocked so I told him and my mom to go ahead of me and I locked everything behind me. We go to the store get what we need and head outside, my mother and I saw something we wanted and told my brother to go get in the car. We came out 2 minutes after him and I put the stuff in the car look in the back seat and the door is open but he is gone. I begin to freak out and we start to drive around while trying to call the cops when he comes out of no where all beat up. We begin to drive him to the hospital when he tells me it’s cause the house was locked and the robbers couldn’t get in. I felt panicked and upset.
comment_text:
Its interesting that he got beat up because the house was locked. That seems key to the dream and might help the meaning click.

The real question Im not sure about is whether brother represents your brother or, if in the dream he represents a part of you...

Also locking the house I think might actually about being/feeling secure, so maybe it is pointing towards where being secure is actually creating some negative consequence?

post_text: I had a dream about my silly brother in law y’all. I had a dream he married his wife twice but he actually didn’t marry her twice at all. He actually married what it looked like someone else to me instead of her. This is his second marriage. He got in the car and left to speak with the older lady in the projects. My brother in law said that he wouldn’t dare marry his wife again if he had a choice.
comment_text:
I wonder if this coukd be symbolizing your own marriage. Maybe your not the same person you were when you married, and your beginning to recognise that.

Getting married twice suggests there is some new stage of commitment to each other. The marriage taking place in the backyard i feel means its of low importance or kept private somehow.

Jogging on the highway towards the projects, maybe you feel your husband has other projects that take him away from the marriage somehow, work or hobbies that he is involved with.

I wonder if you feel your husband feels differently about you.

I vould be on the wrong track here, these ideas are just one way to look at the symbols. Others might have an alternative viewpoint to offer. Sent with kind intentions for your consideration.

post_text: When you lose a pet and you dream about them a lot is that them visiting? I lost my dog a year ago and I dream of her often. Yet I’ve lost family members and never dream of them? That’s why I find it hard to believe that it’s a visit because wouldn’t my family members come through?

Ray Chagen it could be either grief/loss as missing your pet or visitation. It depends on the dream. If your pet is wounded or ill or sick in the dream or there are negative emotions attached to the dream, I usually call it a grief dream. If your pet looks healthy/happy/

post_text: When you lose a pet and you dream about them a lot is that them visiting? I lost my dog a year ago and I dream of her often. Yet I’ve lost family members and never dream of them? That’s why I find it hard to believe that it’s a visit because wouldn’t my family members come through?

Usually, death in dreams means a rebirth by growing out of the past self. Based on our traumas we all develop subconscious coping mechanisms, filters that we experience life through. These anchorages hamper our ability to fully experience and contribute to life.

As I see it, a loving and nurturing environment has allowed her to safely let that wounded self die. When I read the first line of your post I wanted to ask if she had had any trauma at that age. You already mentioned further down that she did so I truly believe that she needs lots of long hugs, and earthing. She needs to increase her water intake, laugh, dance, and engage in creative hobbies through this time of growth and healing into a new phase of her life.

post_text:
I had a dream.

Context : My dad got remarried a few years ago after our mom passed. me and my siblings didn’t like his wife. I moved out first then the rest of them did the same. Ever since I’ve never talked nor seen any of them again. It’s been about 3 years. One of my brothers was abusive. Let’s call him brother 2.

Warning : long read

dream started at what looked like a train station. I was in line waiting for my tickets and carrying my luggages. i got my tickets and was just walking to my station. I suddenly saw brother 1 and immediately panicked thinking.. “why is he here??!” so I decide to take another route. everything seemed good until eventually we made eye contact. I dropped my bags and started running as he chased after me. We then got into a crazy chase. at one point he was able to catch up and grab me asking me to come back home cause mom will miss me. I said no and yanked his arm off of me and eventually got away. Scene suddenly changes to him as he stares at me while I’m getting away then he goes on his phone texting brother 2.. “it’s up to you now.” scene changes back to me as I’m driving around figuring out what I should do next. I decided to stop at what looks like an apartment complex. I started walking around then horror strikes as I saw brother 2. He politely asked me to stop running away and come back home cause mom misses me. I started thinking in my head calling his act a bluff as he was always abusive. I didn’t say anything as I turned around and started running. Then we also got into what seems like a crazy chase. eventually he got a hold of me and started violently trying to get me to come home. He started pulling me hair beating me then I finally managed to get his hand off and escape. I then met this strange man. ( who I don’t know and never seen in real life. ) he told me that he saw the chaos and can help me then proceeded to tell me that the building secretly hold organ auctions and that he can pretend to put me in. It sounded dangerous and really sketchy but I was desperate and said ok. so I followed him into a room as he helped me changed and get dress for what seems like surgeon clothes. Then I laid on a bed as he rolled me into this creepy looking room. So in this room I saw a lot of people who was asleep and indeed looked exactly like what he said it was. In the process of taking in all this horror, Out of nowhere brother 2 came, made a commotion, and punched the guy that was pushing me. I was so scared that I just got up and ran back outside to my car and drove off. dream suddenly changes to what seems like a school. I was parking my car and was making my way up to the elevator then this girl by the name of Victoria ( again I never met or know this women. ) came up to me saying I should’ve gone home and see my parents as they miss me. Turns out she’s someone who lives with our family I’m assuming. I ignored her and went up the elevator. Dream scene then again changes to me sitting in a room with two men who I never met and don’t know. We were all just sitting and talking about our lives. Nothing too personal just the basics. they also started asking things like if I liked being a teacher there I said yes. eventually it was getting dark and the two guys was still there. I started thinking to myself why are they still there?? Do they know my bothers?? Are they purposely stalling?? But I brushed it off as my paranoia. Then I excused myself and was making my way to my car then suddenly I saw someone was driving my car. I immediately panicked and thought my brothers found me but then car suddenly parked in front of me and turns out it was one of the guys that was talking to me earlier and said “sorry I thought this was my car.”

I woke up.
comment_text: Hmmmmm ,just give your dad a call and ask after him and how he's doing. Just chat your family up not necessarily going to them but just a little communication with them it seems they are missing you.
