post_text:
Can you help with these dreams?

I have had multiple dreams of my late husband. They are not feel good dreams and I remember pieces of them.

In one, he is just screaming bad names at me and is very upset. There is not any violence just a screaming match and I just stand there and take it.

In another one, we were out at a park and he was there with someone else and I told him he needed to choose and he chose the other person. Which then led to me screaming at him. One of the things I said was she is only 24! How could you? Then I told him I was going to take everything and I meant everything and then he was like just leave me now.

I have had multiple dreams of him having other partners but none ended with him telling me to go.

What could these mean?

We had (I think) a stable relationship and we were together for a total of 28 years before he passed away. For the last year of his life I did anything and everything for him, as he was very sick with cancer. These also put me in a funk for a few days after too and makes me grieve for him harder. I just want to understand what is happening.
comment_text: Do you feel like you might have feelings of anger/ abandonment towards your late husband? Yelling and infidelity are sometimes signs of those two emotions

post_text:
Can you help with these dreams?

I have had multiple dreams of my late husband. They are not feel good dreams and I remember pieces of them.

In one, he is just screaming bad names at me and is very upset. There is not any violence just a screaming match and I just stand there and take it.

In another one, we were out at a park and he was there with someone else and I told him he needed to choose and he chose the other person. Which then led to me screaming at him. One of the things I said was she is only 24! How could you? Then I told him I was going to take everything and I meant everything and then he was like just leave me now.

I have had multiple dreams of him having other partners but none ended with him telling me to go.

What could these mean?

We had (I think) a stable relationship and we were together for a total of 28 years before he passed away. For the last year of his life I did anything and everything for him, as he was very sick with cancer. These also put me in a funk for a few days after too and makes me grieve for him harder. I just want to understand what is happening.
comment_text: Maybe it is symbolic. In your dream he is moving on and telling you to let him go. Maybe it is your subconscious "screaming" at you to let him go and move on with your life. I know when a loved one passes it sometimes feels like you're not supposed to feel happy anymore because they are gone and moving on with your life would feel like a disrespect to their memory. I felt like that when my dad passed so I can imagine that feeling would be even stronger with a spouse. Maybe your dreams are about your inner conflict where you are torn between grieving him and wanting to stop grieving but feeling like you are supposed to grieve forever. Also, if you believe that loved ones can visit you in your dreams from the other side, it could be taken as a message from him that he wants you to move on and be happy without him. If you had passed instead of him, would you want him to be miserable and miss you for the rest of his life or would you be screaming at him from the other side to find happiness and live for the both of you? Just a thought. The other woman he left you for in your dream could just symbolize him leaving you in this world to be in the next. Even though it wasn't his choice to leave you in reality, that doesn't mean you don't hold anger inside at losing him, whether that anger is at him, or God, or the universe, pain often presents itself in the form of anger. It isn't fair that you lost him, and you feel wronged. Anger is a stage of grief. If you haven't processed your grief fully in your waking life, it will come out in weird ways in your subconscious. I have bizarre dreams of my dad all the time too.

post_text:
Can you help with these dreams?

I have had multiple dreams of my late husband. They are not feel good dreams and I remember pieces of them.

In one, he is just screaming bad names at me and is very upset. There is not any violence just a screaming match and I just stand there and take it.

In another one, we were out at a park and he was there with someone else and I told him he needed to choose and he chose the other person. Which then led to me screaming at him. One of the things I said was she is only 24! How could you? Then I told him I was going to take everything and I meant everything and then he was like just leave me now.

I have had multiple dreams of him having other partners but none ended with him telling me to go.

What could these mean?

We had (I think) a stable relationship and we were together for a total of 28 years before he passed away. For the last year of his life I did anything and everything for him, as he was very sick with cancer. These also put me in a funk for a few days after too and makes me grieve for him harder. I just want to understand what is happening.
comment_text:
The traumas that have pierced us deeply, show up in our dreams as "disturbances".
You say you had a stable relationship and that he was sick during the last year when you gave all of yourself to him. This experience may hold some shadows of self blame, a feeling of not having done enough as is common for many people who take care of their spouses or other relations through a terminal illness. The caretakers question themselves and engage in self-criticism and self judgment..

The age 24 may be implying a few things. It could be that his health started declining 4 years before he passed, it could be implying a significant experience you had at the age of 24.

You have a sense of losing precious time together, there may be a fear of loneliness. Him leaving you behind is being perceived by some part of your Heart as his betrayal, but you're assuming you share the "blame" even as a victim of his betrayal, even in spite of all you did to help.

I see these as the dreams of a Heart on the mend. Life, Death, we don't perceive much beyond the limits of our 5 senses, it doesn't mean nothing exists beyond Life and Death.

He will reach through with increasing clarity as you continue moving upwards, on this spiral of individual growth across time we Humans have the privilege of experiencing as Life on Earth.

You sound like an extremely devoted, loyal, committed, and sincere partner, someone who stands with her companion and doesn't let go when they're drowning.

Some part of our Heart hopes and prays that our input would yield results that would at least partly be based on our deepest desires (you'd have wanted the both of you to stay together forever).

You did everything you could, perhaps some part of you wonders if he did all he could.

Allow yourself to heal. Try to recall your best and healthiest times together.

Write letters to him..

Sending you Love.

post_text: Another ongoing theme I’ve been noticing lately in my nightmares: vertigo. As in, if I’m standing in a tall building, the building starts swaying back and forth and feels like it’s gonna collapse. And I become really dizzy/disoriented/afraid. Or, like in lastnight’s dream, I was in a school bus and the bus kept wanting to tip over, and once it did the windows smashed and I got glass shards all stuck in my face. Another one was of a ship sinking that I was on, but it usually capsizes or starts tipping over first. The stage where said vehicle/area/building begins tipping and swaying usually lasts a long time before it finally collapses. I’m not sure what this means. Just seems like a recurring theme.
comment_text: Being on a tall building and getting dizzy is maybe trying to do too much. Getting too far off the ground. You may need to not try to overdo things. The bus tipping over is some kind of lessons not turning out. The same thing with the ship sinking. Symbolizes your lessons or your goals not working out. With the skyscraper in the beginning is you are trying to accomplish too much. Too high with the dizziness. I feel this dream is saying to take smaller steps in accomplishing your goals with the nightmares. I feel there are steps to your healing this.

post_text:
Last night I dreamed about a tornado. A massive grey tornado heading straight for my town. I was scared but also excited because I’d never seen one in real life. I was watching from a window in a tall building, as I tried to look closer I realized I had walked onto a ledge outside the glass. I quickly returned inside.
The scene switched to a different room. I found two snakes on the floor. One was a boa, the other a python. Both looked in very poor health, one badly burned and the other with skin peeling off. I felt badly for them and wasn’t sure what to do.

Any ideas on what these mean ?
comment_text:
My guess is the dream relates to some unmanageability
or anxiety you are experiencing in your life. Perhaps related to an "aspiration" of yours. Whether that be relationship or job related or something else...its something you are striving for that has potential to fail. But you are clearly in control of it either way. Both of those snakes are constrictors. So one possibility is they represent same issue or peripheral ones that made you feel the "squeeze" in life but turned out to be harmless. Jaime Trujillo

post_text:
I had the weirdest dream, and I remember it vividly. I hope someone can help me to interpret it. I dreamt that a couple committed suicide. They both jumped from a building. But the building was odd. It was a building that was under construction and the whole face of the building was missing. Just imagine looking at a doll house where you could see every floor and every room. That’s the way the building looked. But there was a long black screen draping the front of the building. The police were there, trying to talk the couple out of jumping. They were unsuccessful. The woman pushed the screen and jumped, and the man jumped right after her.
I can’t figure this one out.
comment_text:
Death often symbolizes a change or transformation.
So these people could symbolize aspects of yourself that are changing. There might be a part of yourself that your changing or putting an end to. The police could symbolize the part of you that is trying to stop it from happening and keep those aspects alive. The dream is showing that this part of you was unsuccessful. It's possible that the two people are symbolic of someone else you know who is changing out putting and end to an old aspect of themselves. And the police - the side of yourself that's trying to stop it. A house often represents the self. Your self is under construction - being worked on. And you can see into every part of the self because it's missing a wall. So you're perhaps being transparent? But yet there is this black screen covering the face of the building. So maybe you are trying to conceal the fact that you are under construction or working on yourself. So maybe the transparent thing is wrong.

post_text: Had this dream where I was at the car wash. So I could get my car washed. There was a car in front of mine. The whole thing exploded before my eyes. I pulled up and the attendent said he did not belong. He had me pop my hood, hosed the engine then had me go through. He said I'm fine and I went through. When I came out I was on a bicycle and a Ghostbuster. My first job was recruit people and bust a cave witch, her husband who is a Djinn and their children.
comment_text:
Hi, I have a few suggestions. My thoughts are thaf the dream is about the way you are progressing with your life. You know you need to clean things up.

Perhaps you have some conserns that you are headed towards a risky or volatile future in some way. And this is a future to which you know you dont belong.

The engine I feel is about your inner self and your own personal source of power. What is if that makes "your motor run"? What is if that gets you going in life, that gives you drive and motivation? Have lost your motivation for life? Do you need a tune up, because your dream suggests you need to clean this up too! Water can of course represent emotions and healing. Washing is a symbol of cleasing. The attendant is a part of you, the part that needs to pay attention and "attend" to these inner parts so you move forward with power.

When you "clean up" this attendant part knows you will be fine.

The bike suggests that you need to become more indipendant and to focus on your own very personal journey in life. There maybe some ghosts from yoyr past that also need busting in order for you to do this.

I feel the job you must do is to get some help and support. Who can you recruit or employ, to help you bust these ghosts? Perhaps a therapist or councellor?

The cave is an ancient symbol for the inner dark caverns of our own self. The place where our shadow self hides. All the parts that we reject and repress, all the parts of our own selves that cause us trouble. Parts that have been hurt, insecurities, shame, anger etc. The witch and her husband suggest a sense of "evil" or badness you perhaps feel inhabits your own darkness. There is a clear family unit here too so there could be some links to you'd own family or upbringing.

In my opinion this is a powerful dream that calls you to do some personal work and healing. I wish you courage in your efforts.

post_text:
I had a dream once as a 5 year old child. Today, at 55 yrs of age, I still cannot shake it. **I am an extremely vivid dreamer ever since I can remember. This one however still has me scratching me head.

I was 5 years old and I was inside my older sister’s high school. I found myself at the bottom of this big staircase which reminded me of a pyramid. The stairs opened (lifted)up and there were bright red, orange, and yellow fire coming from the earth under the stairs. It was Hell and I knew it. It was so hot. I was in complete fear. It wanted me to walk into the flames but I was paralyzed by fear and then I woke up.

Never thought to ask but I’m grounding myself outside and something told me to share this here. Any thoughts? TIA 💜
comment_text: To me it woukd suggest that you felt you must face some fears at the time.

post_text: At first me and my partner were making love for a very long time. I remember crossing many check boxes on a paper we had written. It was important and precise. A little later a bee came on my neck. It was unbearably ticklish and I had trouble keeping still and fell to the floor. I shouted please lift it off of me otherwise my reflexes will take over. I would rather it got moved peacefully so that it could survive and I wouldn't get a sting. It crawled up and down on my throat like it was it's favourite spot in the world.
comment_text:
Hi, my thoughts are that the dream is about your relationship. Perhaps you have been together for a ling time? And there are many important aspects of your relationship that meet your requirements or checklist. The bee can be a symbol of hard work or working as a team. The drones serve their queen and they all work together for to provide for the community and their offspring.

The tickling I feel is the dreams way of saying there is an irritation here. Something is bothering you. This irritation you would like to be rid of but it has "floored you" somewhat.
I feel you are worried that you will get to point where you will do something impulsive. The be walking on your throat is a prompt for you to talk about whatever it is about your "bee-ing" that is bothering you.

comment_text: I have those kind of dreams too or I keep losing the baby or forgetting it. I think a baby symbolizes a dream or project, or some new potential coming up in your life. For me I think it usually means I keep putting too many other things ahead of myself so I don’t prioritize my own potentials.

post_text:
Hello and thanks for the add! My grandfather that raised me has been fighting cancer and on hospice for months. We have an indescribable bond. On April 22 I had a dream about him. In my dream he was in the same condition and he stood up out of bed and I was scared he was going to fall. I remember he just stared at me in my dream but thats all I remember.
That same morning my grandmother had called me to let me know that he had passed away at some time in the middle of the night. She also told me that evening he was very combative and fell out of bed. Its just crazy to me because I've never dreamed of him before or really dream at all.
What does this mean? Did he visit me before passing over?
I never really believed in this stuff until now.
I saw him a few days before his passing but we never really said our true goodbyes to eachother because I was supposed to see him today but he was too weak to make it.
comment_text:
I'm sorry for your loss.
It's not uncommon at the end of someone's life for dreams to indicate the imminent death, or a death just passed. Carl Jung's work described numerous such cases. The unconscious perceives and knows far more than we might think it ought to.

post_text: I dreamt I was in a room that looked a lot like my old apartment except bigger. I dreamt I was trying to find someone and if I knocked on the walls and listen I would hear them I put my ear up to the wall and was knocking on the wall in several places. I could hear them slightly knocking back. This went on for a little bit and then I woke up. Strange, of course I usually have the strange dreams lol. Any thoughts? Please and thank you! If you have a moment.
comment_text: This is apartment the newer version of yourself. That is why it's bigger. The knocking on the wall is about finding connections with new opportunities for growth and learning.

post_text: I’ve has a lot of dreams lately about my family’s health. One dream was about my dad being sick, and last night i had a dream of my mother drowning in a bathtub, and that my grandma passed away of a collapsed lung. Any interpretations would be helpful, thank you
comment_text: You are dreaming about losing things that are important to you. Something in your waking life is causing you anxiety. Could just be a change coming you are not ready for.

post_text: I’ve has a lot of dreams lately about my family’s health. One dream was about my dad being sick, and last night i had a dream of my mother drowning in a bathtub, and that my grandma passed away of a collapsed lung. Any interpretations would be helpful, thank you
comment_text:
I see this as:
Father = the head. Perhaps it is sick in thoughts or beliefs.
Mother = life force and instinct.
Bathtub = hygiene and relaxation. Perhaps, all that has been taken for granted and expected is being suffocated by new environmental elements that require specialized tools in which to survive.
Grandmother = matriarchy and practical wisdom. Without lungs there is no breath, there is no voice. The new is being stifled by the old.
Summary: Change what isn’t working by reprogramming the inner dialogue, adapt to the significant changes in life by learning new skills. Finally, the roots are good; so prune back all the unnecessary branches that are hiding the flowers of spring.

post_text:
Hey guys, so this is my 2nd dream in a row where I dream about my black cat giving birth.

(My waking life consists of me trying to get my upgrading and education done to be a vet and I do have a black cat that is (I 90% believe) pregnant)

So, the night before last I dreamed about my cat giving birth and I was also trying to go to school and i was trying to go to the dentist (I can't remember the full dream, but that's what it included)

Last night, I dreamed that my cat was giving birth again but this time we were in a hospital and the male doctor came and checked on us but we were there for a different reason. Then, I had a "friend" there that was pregnant and delivering her baby. When I found out my cat was giving birth i felt like i had to hide and save her so i rush her home then i come back to the hospital for my friend. When I returned she gave birth to 21 babies! 🤯 then when I returned to my cat she gave birth to 6 babies.

After the first dream, I felt like I had to "grow up" more and be a "true" adult. Like right now I'm just going through the phase.

The 2nd dream when I woke up I was in a bit of disbelief of what I saw. The guy doctor was really good looking (never seen him before), and I was kind of excited but a bit stressed about the kittens.

Everything that I've found online isn't making much sense, so I thought I would come here and see. Thanks!
comment_text:
Sounds like you have too much going on at the same time and you are worried about all the new responsibilitie
s you will have to take care of in the near future

post_text: Hello I’m new here. Delete if not okay! 8 months ago I started dreaming daily out of no where. I am going to start posting dreams here. I dream sometimes 4 times a night. Kind of scares me, is this normal? Thank you in advance I can not find anyone who relates.
comment_text:
While its probably statistically not normal I have seen this discussed at times. Sometimes in conjunction with reduced or ceased use of medication or recreational drug use but that isn't always the case.

But hopefully we might be able to help figure out what your unconscious is trying to get your attention about.

post_text: Hello I’m new here. Delete if not okay! 8 months ago I started dreaming daily out of no where. I am going to start posting dreams here. I dream sometimes 4 times a night. Kind of scares me, is this normal? Thank you in advance I can not find anyone who relates.
comment_text: I dream daily and many dreams every night, have done this since childhood.

post_text: Hello I’m new here. Delete if not okay! 8 months ago I started dreaming daily out of no where. I am going to start posting dreams here. I dream sometimes 4 times a night. Kind of scares me, is this normal? Thank you in advance I can not find anyone who relates.
comment_text: Apparently everyone dreams up to 6 dreams a night, but people often do not remember any of them. I think a few factors such as food and diet, stress, and also allowing your body enough time to rest/getting into a deeper sleep, will alter the memory of dreams. Also if you start thinking of your dreams, writing them down to remember them, you start to remember dreams more.

post_text: Hello I’m new here. Delete if not okay! 8 months ago I started dreaming daily out of no where. I am going to start posting dreams here. I dream sometimes 4 times a night. Kind of scares me, is this normal? Thank you in advance I can not find anyone who relates.
comment_text:
You’re not alone, I dream daily, although mine are nightmares. I have depression/
anxiety/so on so forth, but I’ve been anxious most of my life and the dreams didn’t fully start until I was in my late teens. Many people will tell you it isn’t normal, but try not to feel alone in it, because there are people who are similar. I’ve only met a very very select few who could relate to me and it’s mainly online. I can remember most of my dreams, and if I don’t remember them straight away, they usually come back to me at a later date. A lot of them are so vivid that I get them mixed up with reality.

post_text:
Bizarre dream….I was standing in my pops house that no longer stands and I was in the lounge room and there were pigeons, heaps of them, sitting on top of some ledge near the ceiling. I was sort of walking around and I saw my mum and then one of my brothers. Next moment all the pigeons flew away but all I saw was this white poop everywhere, on the curtains and walls. My dad came into the scene and I said to him I will clean this up some how. In my head I was trying to work out the safest way to clean it up. I Thought if I take down the curtains first and wash them, as I thought of this and imagined it I saw the windows exposed which then made it easier to see the mess on the walls. As I was trying to work out how to clean that I was woken up by my son 😔 so I never got to see the end result.
I didn’t feel any negativity in the dream and bizarrely enough, my pop did have a pigeon house in his backyard so I do wonder what the correlation is.
Also, I always dream about this house, why is it so significant in my dream!
comment_text: I am assuming your dad has passed. These pigeons in the dream are saying that your dad's influence is in your life. The poop is the things that your dad has taught you. What he left behind. Cleaning it up is you learning from him.

post_text:
Bizarre dream….I was standing in my pops house that no longer stands and I was in the lounge room and there were pigeons, heaps of them, sitting on top of some ledge near the ceiling. I was sort of walking around and I saw my mum and then one of my brothers. Next moment all the pigeons flew away but all I saw was this white poop everywhere, on the curtains and walls. My dad came into the scene and I said to him I will clean this up some how. In my head I was trying to work out the safest way to clean it up. I Thought if I take down the curtains first and wash them, as I thought of this and imagined it I saw the windows exposed which then made it easier to see the mess on the walls. As I was trying to work out how to clean that I was woken up by my son 😔 so I never got to see the end result.
I didn’t feel any negativity in the dream and bizarrely enough, my pop did have a pigeon house in his backyard so I do wonder what the correlation is.
Also, I always dream about this house, why is it so significant in my dream!
comment_text:
The house symbolizes your mind, and the people in it are your inner energies (our energy is on a spectrum with two ends - Masculine and Feminine).

You say you spoke only to your father as he arrived at the scene when you saw the mess. You spoke about cleaning up the place. This to me indicates that you are using your power of discernment and action to engage in shadow-work. Shadow-work is about facing our shadows and cleaning up our psychological anchorages. It requires focus, courage, will power, determination, and discernment. These are all aspects of the Masculine side of the energy spectrum. The Father indicated that you'd be falling back on your learned Masculine ways to engage in this work. The Feminine side is about openness, acceptance, tolerance, patience etc. That remained in the background in your dream along with the young Masculine. You're engaging a specific section of your mind to do this inner work.

The pigeons may symbolize your natural self, the unconditioned self trying to shine through your conditioned self. Excrement of any form in dreams is usually symbolic of creativity so your dream would imply you have immense potential waiting to be unleashed, which without active channeling has led to a scattered mess within. Perhaps the element of shyness or conditioning of "right and wrong" is playing a part in you stifling some aspects of yourself.

You remove the "curtains" to clean them. That's symbolic of voluntarily uncovering the deeper wounds, the deeper self, and also symbolic of being open to Light (to enlightenment, to self-awareness)
by willingly uncovering the access to your own Self.

As there was more Light, you did see more of what you needed to "clean". This naturally happens when we go down this path of actively engaging in our spiritual ascension through shadow-work. More and more comes to light that needs to be transmuted.

In each moment in life, we deal with the issue at hand to the best of our knowledge, capacity, and intentions at that given point. This may lead to discovering things that would leave us feeling demotivated, but our Masculine energies of persistence and courage always come in handy.

The dream was interrupted, but I believe it has conveyed to you the message it carried. You're subconsciously growing into a new person because the global environment has been changing drastically, yet on some levels imperceptibly. The same dynamic is being reflected in all individuals based on our unique circumstances.

Depending on how your life may have been changing (I didn't see an indication of turbulence, just natural smooth ascension and growth), the dream indicates that you're actively finding ways to express your true self in spite of how things may appear initially.

I always suggest earthing and grounding, and I also suggest visualization meditation to feed especially the Heart Chakra with the intention that the Heart will strengthen the other six. I also recommend aiming for at least 3 litres of water a day. It really helps with the process somehow.

post_text: I had a dream that I bought a car from my sister but it wouldn’t crank for some reason as you had to put a band over the gas tank to crank it. I had to put $20 in the tank but the guy who pumped my gas went a little over. I had $50 in my bank account in the dream and the teller said it out loud. My sister belittled me calling me broke constantly. I had gotten a job at FedEx by catching a bus there. I worked at Fed Ex in the past. Thankfully I haven’t talked to my sister in many months because all she did was abuse me. Could this mean anything?

Hmm, I ses the car as a journey, might be about how you can't juat expect this journey to start; that it is going to take work, and tge work has to be done in the correct way beyond just pure brawn or will but intellect too, knowing how to get it started.

Also seems to be concern over putting yourself out there with humiliation in regards to how much value you have? It might be hinting towards motivation, that it shouldn't be or won't be financial based?

post_text:
I had the most intense dream I’ve ever had lastnight. It was a nightmare, but I think it’s legitimately the most vivid dream I’ve ever had in my life. And I already dream vividly regardless. So this was really intense. I’m not gonna bother trying to explain it because it’s too hard to explain. It literally felt like I was in an alternate universe, and that this stuff is still going on in the dream world right now as I type this. I wanna go back to that dream to see what happens. I feel like the people in the dream need help, and they’re all dying while I’m still awake.

EDIT: I decided to add a quick summary of *most* of the dream. This isn’t the full thing obviously, just a brief explanation because there are honestly too many things going on and too many strong emotions to cover.

In said dream I was part of some unit made up of child soldiers (except I wasn’t child, the others were) called the “F.S.W unit” or something like that, where all the kids line up and start filing in to this platform in the middle of a huge arena where there’s crowds all around watching, and once they get to the platform it’s like Russian roulette where there’s a 50/50 chance that a few will end up dying.
The way they end up dying is that Chucky (you know, the creepy doll) runs around underneath the platform with his hand out, grabbing the kid’s hands, and if the kid squeezes his hand back then he sentences them to death by chasing after them with a huge knife.
I eventually caught onto this, so I stopped squeezing his little hand whenever he’d put it out and he was like “fucksakes, this bitch is gonna be a tricky one” or something (sorry for the language).
Then I had a military uniform on and gear and had to crawl/run really fast throughout a series of tunnels that my bedroom was connected to in order to get away.
Then my boyfriend was there, but can’t really remember what he was doing. I was sitting in fetus position up against a wall with all my stuff on and I just remember him bending down in front of me and saying something, but I had PTSD and was confused.
Then when Chucky captured me, I sprouted wings and transformed into some purple bird god named “Raksha” and was able to get away and they were like “It’s the second coming of Raksha! All hail!” Or something.
comment_text:
My thinking in this is it is like an inner dimension that reflects what is going on within.

I'm not sure, at first i thought the military uniform was hinting at conflict but on reflection I think it is about discipline - and using discipline to overcome a fake (Chucky doll) self destructive pattern of behaviour, particularly aroubd learning not to indulge in what appears to be offered as a symbol if caring/love/
support (Chucky's hand) but really isn't.

So overcoming that allows transformation and empowerment is how I read the end if the dream. Maybe freedom in a sense with those wings allowing escape.

post_text:
Let me begin this by saying I am "sensitive" to the supernatural beings of the world, even if there are some people who don't believe it, I am, so is my mom, and so is my Aunt. Please do your best to help me understand the following dream:
I have night terrors. I woke up in a panic because in my dream my husband and I had to go to a jailhouse so he could file a report. He wanted me to go with him so I said okay. They took him to a room by himself and put me in the medical ward, I don't know why , apparently I was hurt. Though I didn't appear to be on the outside. I was laying on a gurney. My feet were by the wall my head was by the foot of the bed. Things from a shelf above me kept flying and hitting me. I felt something very very cold so I looked too my left and there was a girl with short hair. She looked like she was maybe around 18 or 19. I was describing her to the medical ward clerk and she told me that I was describing a girl who had died in the psych ward portion of the jail. After the lady told me that, somebody else came in and said "she tries to mess with everybody just ignore her and she'll go away" So I was trying to ignore her, and then she she choked me really hard to the point where it pulled me out of my sleep and I had to wake my husband up because I couldn't breathe and my throat was just hurting so bad. Now my throat is just scratchy, but I don't have any marks which is a good thing. Though it is still pretty hard to swallow.
comment_text:
Hm, it seem the spirit is trying to get your attention, ignoring it seems to be making it worse. Usually in dream, what you trying to ignore or run away from is the thing you need to face the most.
Nightmares/
shadow usually hold gold around our skill/abilitiy/
purpose, if we can identify and accept it.
You said you are sensitive and this can be crippling in itself sort of like overdialed emphathy (also hospital reference) but the dream may be saying "communication with spirits 'is your gift (since you are describing it to someone in the dream who can't see what you see). Like some very connected psychics are helping police solving the mysterious disappearance/
deaths with the information they receive from the spirit world.
The fact that you physically feel this testify how you are the bridge between the worlds.
It could be what you have karmically agreed to develop this time around ( especially if some papers were falling from above shelf). If we don't develop what we agreed to, we can become unwell too.
You can ask before going to sleep tonight for your dream mind to send you some more clearer messages.

I was describing her to the medical ward clerk and she told me that I was describing a girl who had died in the psych ward portion of the jail. After the lady told me that, somebody else came in and said "she tries to mess with everybody just ignore her and she'll go away" So I was trying to ignore her, and then she she choked me really hard to the point where it pulled me out of my sleep and I had to wake my husband up because I couldn't breathe and my throat was just hurting so bad. Now my throat is just scratchy, but I don't have any marks which is a good thing. Though it is still pretty hard to swallow.
comment_text: Bad, bad dream! You have a sore throat, and you might be running a little fever to make you had a bad dream. In general a warning to slow down and protect your health.

post_text:
I am regularly dreaming about being with women. Every time this has happened it has been sexual dreams so I don’t want to share the details (I don’t think it’s needed). Sometimes this is someone I make up in my head, sometimes it’s someone famous that I like. Each time, I’m doing things that I don’t do nor do I have any interest in doing with my husband (or any man at all). I’m not a very sexually oriented person in real life. It doesn’t interest me and I could quite happily live without it.

When I wake up, I wake up happy and feeling content and aroused (sorry tmi). These have been some of the most vivid dreams I’ve ever had and some of the only dreams that have ever given me a physical reaction while sleeping that I wake up with.

Some details in case they are needed. I am married to a man, we’ve been together 12 years and married for 5. I have never, even at the start of the relationship, dreamt of him like this. I’ve never dreamt of any man like this. I do identify as bisexual, but I’ve never actually had any experience of dating or being with a woman.
comment_text:
Dreams are a safe way to explore thoughts and desires, it is healthy and natural.

In addition to the physical desires of the dreams, a dream about sex can also be interpreted symbolically.

It can mean a symbol of loving oneself, embracing a part of oneself, psychological integration.

To dream about being with other women might be about connecting with other parts of your femininity or different ways to express being a woman.

A celebrity might have specific symbolizing. For example dreaming of having sex with Madonna might symbolize embracing the duality of your innocence + sexuality

It might also be dreams that are allowing you to accept and embrace your own sexuality

It sounds like they are happy dreams

post_text: I had a dream last night that I gave birth to twins. I thought one was a boy and one was a girl. I was taken away from them for a few days (idk why). When I got back I realized they were both girls. One had freckles and the other did not, which I thought was strange but cute. Their father named them without me (idk who the father was). He named one of them Maleficence, somehow the baby communicated to me that she did not like this name, I agreed and told her maybe we should compromise and call her Maleficent, since it might be more socially acceptable. One twin suggested the name Kimmy. I also remember breastfeeding these twins in my dream. Any thoughts? This morning when I woke up and went to work, my first appointment at work was a mother with twins which I thought was a funny coincidence, however I do work with Moms and children often.
comment_text: Giving birth to girl means good news n giving birth to boy means bad news

post_text:
Hi everyone!! I had a dream recently that kind of freaked me out. I first want to say no I don't have suicidal thoughts & I have no idea what caused this dream. But anyways here it is:

I was captured by 2 men & there were a few other people with me but the main guy killed them right away, so I was the only one left. I begged him not hurt me, to not kill me. He laughed and said he wouldn't. He then put the gun to my head and I begged him once again not to kill me. He said he wouldn't and then he pulled the trigger but nothing came out (it wasn't a revolver). Then he pulled the trigger a second time and nothing came out and he was annoyed. The third time he pulled the trigger a bullet came out and went right into the right side of my head. In that moment I could literally feel myself from dying. There was no pain, my body turned numb/limp/tingly, I saw my vision changing, it was like I was moving into a different dimension or a different world. It was bright and welcoming but not plain nothingness. It was so calming, peaceful moving though my vision was split. Basically on my right side I could see myself moving to that new place but on my left side I could see my body laying there in that abandoned warehouse thing we were in.

I think what scared me most is how peaceful it felt moving into that new dimension/world. I just can't shake that feeling. It's almost like it was telling me it's okay to die (when that time comes obviously).
comment_text:
I do agree with you about the dream that it is saying about death. I also see something more. This dream could be symbolizing change, transformation.
You are transforming in life right now. Death in a dream symbolizes change. This dream could be saying that the old you is passing away and a more peaceful version of yourself is emerging. It's a process because of you noticing the difference from one side of yourself to the other. You fear the gun because we generally fear change. In the end you realize that you don't have to fear change.

post_text:
First time posting! Let me know your thoughts please 💙 Can’t find a meaning anywhere. I dreamt over three consecutive nights with the element of water in it…

First night of dreaming: I was running away from a day time rain, the skies were a beautiful bright blue. It was coming after me, I didn’t want it to touch me. I was jumping from roof top to rooftop in a place that resembled the favela of Brazil. Suddenly there’s a helicopter and someone who I can’t see their face reaches their hand out to me and pulls me inside before the rain could touch me. I’m dry and saved. I wake up.

Second night of dreaming: I’m now wet, the rain has touched me. I’m in a forest somewhere. There’s a women who feels like a spirit. I only see her from the back, I can’t tell her age wether she’s young or old, maybe she had white braided hair and wearing native clothes. she’s running somewhere and I feel like I must follow her, so I do. She leads me to shelter. I wake up.

Third night of dreaming: I’m alone and dry. I’m on a beach somewhere, and in the distance of the horizon is the most magical scene I’ve ever seen. There’s a massive tsunami wave touching the skies like it was reaching out for heaven, wide as the eye can see everywhere I look from left to right. It stayed in it’s place, just flowing up, it wasn’t coming after me. The sunset was shining through it, illuminating its power and beauty. I was in awe and wonder, mesmerized and unafraid. I felt empowered. I wake up.
comment_text:
Water is often associated with emotions, the unconscious or spirituality. With the native woman and the wonder of the third dream Im certainly getting spiritual vibes. Im wondering if tgey are giving different views on the same scenario? In the first its saving from facing the waters through unnatural means (the helicopter - often a symbol of ego as it rotates around itself); the second is a spiritual journey based in nature, the third, unguided wonder, but maybe lacking understanding?

These are my favourite kind of dreams but often don't seem to have a simple answer or interpretation.

Agree with Timothy. Water would typically represent the unconscious and/or emotions.

Interesting that the tidal wave was not destructive. The woods is sometimes said to be a symbol of the Self.

post_text:
For you dream interpreters out there. I had a dream last night where I was at some yard sale and saw a beautiful carved desk. It was an antique and very detailed. I reach into a small drawer and drew out a big wad of money. Very old money - and I stole it.
then I woke up. I wonder what that dream means. Please...im not a thief -\-\ but I had the strong knowledge that I was being very wrong and sneaky.

ive had other dreams where I steal jewelry from an old jewelry box -\-\ so this dream is kind of a repeat which usually means its important to figure out (or I will keep on having these dreams).
comment_text: Taking money from the desk symbolizes taking something or claiming something that is not yours for yourself when it not yours. This is the guilt. This ornate desk symbolizes someone else's creativity. You are claiming something that is not yours in the dream.

post_text:
For you dream interpreters out there. I had a dream last night where I was at some yard sale and saw a beautiful carved desk. It was an antique and very detailed. I reach into a small drawer and drew out a big wad of money. Very old money - and I stole it.
then I woke up. I wonder what that dream means. Please...im not a thief -\-\ but I had the strong knowledge that I was being very wrong and sneaky.

ive had other dreams where I steal jewelry from an old jewelry box -\-\ so this dream is kind of a repeat which usually means its important to figure out (or I will keep on having these dreams).
comment_text:
Hi Patricia, you are completely right, recurring dream themes hold special power, so well done asking for the clarity on dream's message.
I ll preface the dream that everything in the dream is you/aspect of you and so finding this ornate desk in a yard sale symbolism is a dream's way of saying you need to find (and appreciate) your own beauty and by going further inside /opening certain part of you/checking the inside, you are to discover your value. Yard sale would indicate some sentiment around old stuff/no longer serving/but also letting go as people are usually doing it when decluttering/
moving on
There is a feeling of guilt that has surfaced in the dream but try to work with and identify the presence of this feeling in your body away from the actual imagery (which the dream is just using to open your eyes to this guilt).
Sometimes giving yourself the permission to find your beauty and value (again) will come with a hinged guilt attached ('who do you think you are' type of voice) and this guilt can be cultural and societal /passed down the family line..not to absolve from our own, but do take a wider view when looking at this.
Desk is a female symbol here (curiously no chair mentioned). Finally, desk can be an invitation to writing, like journaling to try get to deeper layers of yourself.

post_text:
Dreamt that I was in a house with my partner and as I looked outside, I could see black clouds almost touching the ground passing by in the open field. In the dream, I felt a bit of anxiety, thinking I've never seen such darck clouds ever before. As I looked out the window, I could see a cowboy hearding a beautiful black horse out of the storm's way. The rider looked worryed and he was pushing his horse as hard as he could to get out of the way, but the storm was catching up with him. It felt like he was trying to protect the stallion ahead of him (which looked quite small in comparison). Inside the house, my partner was holding onto a piece of furniture as the house started to shake as the storm was coming closer.
Can you give me a clue, please? I looked into it and found pieces of information that I cannot out together to form a coherent idea.

Thank you so much Xx
The below picture is to give a sense of the clouds and the solitude of the house in the middle of the field.
comment_text: The horse being herded away from a dark cloud is a challenge in life coming that needs attention. It could be something that you are aware of and this dream is saying to pay attention before this over takes you. The cowboy symbolizes help that is there for you.

post_text: I’m not sure where the dream started but all I remember is it starting in the middle for me, I was in my room and a girl i went to school with little sister was there like sitting by a drain and she told me that she kept feeling something touch her through the drain and I look over and she’s not there anymore and I see them trying to grab a stuffed animal that was right beside her thinking it’s me or something and I hit their hand and I screamed, what did you do with, Izzy, but that’s not even her name. I’m freaking out because I’m thinking how much strength did they have to have to pull this little red headed girl through and drain, and how messed up her body was look now! (This whole time I was crying.) So I tell everyone in the house that someone is going through the drains and trying to steal people or anything they can grab. So I get advised by someone to go tell my father which is at my neighbors franks, as I’m telling him what’s happening, the across the street neighbor truck starts going off as if someone’s breaking in. (I want to add some better description of how close we live , imagine a square and it’s three houses but my house has two acres so it would take up the room for the forth house to have our houses right across the street from each other’s) so my dad and frank look at each other and say that’s probably him and after they say that the older guy right across the street with his truck broken into step out his door and screams. “HES HEADED YALLS WAY” so the person who broke in was a mid sized,black male. But I remembered seeing a white hand through the drain. So sense we live so close I tried to run to my house for safety and it was too late, my dad pull out his Glock the guy pulled out his gun and two shots were fired and I just shut my eye and I seen white, and it was like as if I felt the bullets as well but I just kept walking towards my house. I didn’t even look to see who had died I just went back to my room crying to my mom and my boyfriend and as I’m on the floor like hysterically crying I stand up and through the window I see the black male wrapped up (dead) and being put into like a police van. I distinctly remember after I seen his dead body in my head I went “I just seen a dead body”. I went into more of a shock and then more of a hysterical cry, and I remember my mom trying to get my grandma to come out and to calm me down, she gets to my house I head outside, and the last part before I woke I just remember sinking into her arms while falling on the prettiest, greenest grass I’ve ever seen.
comment_text:
This is a pretty complex dream, Im nit sure I have any solid ideas; but it does seem to relate to being influenced by outside forces (those taking people through the drain) snd being intruded upon, feeling threatened and conflict.

Since it isnt the black man I think the dream might be hinting the real threat is not the clear seemingly obvious intrusion but rather the seemingly impossible reverse way (through the drain).

The grass at the end seems significant, makes me think of lush rich personal growth but through great sorrow and difficulty?

post_text:
I had a dream that I had a bunch of puppies in my house & an aggressive dog got in & started taking all the puppies one by one & putting them in a tent in the back garden I was crying & hiding terrified. It was dark & rainy in the garden & every time the dog was bringing one out I was bringing one back in trying to save them but hiding so I wasn’t seen. I was going back & forth when I realised one of the puppies were drowning in a paddling pool that was filling fast with the rain, I tried to save the puppy but I couldn’t, the aggressive dog wouldn’t stop barking at me & biting at my clothes but I was just crying holding this dead pup in the rain.

what could this mean?
one of the most vivid & horrible dreams Iv ever had. 😞
comment_text:
The house is a symbol of self. I think this is a symbol of you in conflict with some unconscious process: the yard being the unconscious, the interior the conscious. I think you are in conflict with a natural but unempathic unconscious process (the aggressive dog) that is trying to put something outside of your conscious awareness but you keep bringing it back inside ie keep thinking about it?

Not sure what the puppies actually represent...

post_text:
So my friend had a dream she had sex with a ghost. She said “it was weird bc he told me he died, he didn’t tell me how. My soul knew he was dead, but it was almost like he was more like a time traveler. I knew exactly what he looked like bc he would show himself, he appeared in human form and he couldn’t remember how to go back to his ghost form. He felt real, the dream felt real, and weirdly it felt like we had a soul connection. It was like I had known him for years but I had just met him.”

I’m curious if anyone can help me figure this out for her? I have tried looking up the meaning but can’t really find anything on it. I personally do not think it was a succubus, but I really don’t know how to interpret it to help her make sense of it.
comment_text:
Only she can really understand it when the pieces click, but you might be able to help give clues she is overlooking with an outsiders perspective.

For starters the sex is quite possibly not even about sex at all. In fact I'd argue this is an Animus dream using sex as a symbol of integration. That male I suspect represents masculine aspects of her own psyche she rejected in the past and "killed off" from her persona (hence ghost of her past) that she is now reconnecting with and accepting. There is a soul connection there because it is the Animus ie a part of her soul.

post_text: Hi everyone. Today I was woken up by a voice saying my name loud and urgently. I immediately jumped out of bed to find my husband and baby asleep with obviously no one else in our house. It was extremely clear, almost like they were right next to me. Has this happened to anyone else? What does it mean?
comment_text: This is called a hypnogogic hallucination. It's very common. I've experienced it several times. It's the brain playing tricks as you wander between sleep state and awake state. This experience is very unsettling but I don't believe there is any value in trying to interpret it.

post_text:
Ok so, I had a friend who passed in a pretty messed up way. There is suspected foul play.

I had a dream about her and I just want some thoughts and opinions…

In the dream, I walked into a room (I’d never been to this house nor seen it) and saw her hanging out with some of our other friends. She had already passed and was a ghost. I laid down beside her and caressed her face. I said, “I’m so happy to see you *****.” She said, “I’m not *****, I’m *****.” But I just can’t remember the name she said.

That gave me weird vibes but I just went with it. She asked me to go into the bathroom with her and I did. She started trying to put her fingers into my mouth and literally tear it open. Then she started trying to put her mouth on mine, violently.

We seemed to teleport from the bathroom to a car that she was is control of and wrecked. Then we seemed to teleport back to the house. I saw few people talking. It was said that, “The doll she gave her was an investigator.” I was hiding. She didn’t see me at first and I was trying to leave before she did. I made it outside but she saw me on the porch. She was trying to full on attack and a few other ghosts of people I knew were helping but I can’t remember who they were now.

I kept repeating, “I banish thee!” Over and over until I woke up.

I know that I knew everyone but I can’t remember names or who anyone was but her.

Now I just feel so uneasy and weird.
comment_text: That this lady didn't go by the name you called her is saying that you really didn't know her. To me this dream is saying that your friend wasn't who she seemed and the rest of the dream where things are switching around and you hiding is you are finding this out. That you are casting her out in the dream symbolizes her false face.

post_text: I'm having this dream lately I'm in secondary school and in biology and a teacher pours chemicals on an avocado on the floor and fumes come out and we all get a buzz and can't stop laughing what could this mean thanks.
comment_text:
Hi Lyndsey, thanks for sharing your dream. School/teacher and floor (where you are standing/pun on understanding) indicates you are learning something about your life (biology) The shape of avocado (usually pictured in a oval shape with a neck and seed can represent the uterus /reproduction area. Dream seem to be bringing up something to the surface. You didn't describe what kind of chemical, but in this context chemical is something man made/ie unnatural and perhaps even harmful.
Not sure if this is enough for you to piece/sense any further message together.

comment_text:
You had a very strong connection with her it seems. She was opening your mouth violently because she was herself struggling to express herself. As I see this, she probably thought about some of the people she could call during her final moments. As you have said the accident was bad, perhaps she had some moments of fear. Perhaps the images that reached you triggered some fear and she was struggling to get through.

Either way, her being with a group should indicate she's not alone and helpless as she might have felt. It's in my book a beautiful sign as well and perhaps she just came over to say hi and the rest of it was you both having a conversation in which you were trying to tell her how deeply hurt you are, and perhaps she was trying to tell you that she was ready to move on..

post_text:
I dreamed about my dad giving me a ride to my doctors appointment. The time was 2:08PM. We saw red lights flashing at the railroad crossing. Dad stopped at the railroad crossing and waited for the train. We looked left and right to see if the freight train was approaching. Dad thought about going through. He did a U-Turn and went a different direction to the doctors office. We arrived at the doctors office. Dad walked ahead of me upstairs to the doctors office. I lost sight of him. I ran up the first flight of stairs then I heard footsteps thinking it was my dad walking up the steps but it was someone else. When I was about halfway up the steps I heard them announce my name on the Public Announcement System. I reached the 3rd floor where the doctors office was located I saw old clients sitting in their chairs then I woke up.

Can anyone help interpret this dream?
comment_text:
You might be on autopilot atm.
What I mean is you think logic and avoid thinking emotionally.

The train that isn’t coming is kinda of the expression “missing the train” but it isn’t quite it.
You “don’t see a train”.
You are waiting at flashing light so there is a sense of emergency/
danger ahead.
You do a u-turn.

It can be seen as “forget Plan A, let’s take plan B”.
(Change of directory instead of waiting… acting upon).

Going upstairs is seen as “improving your life”.
You dad is ahead of you.
Maybe you need guidance a little bit.

Doctors appointment is to “fix something with you.”

Fixing something maybe you aren’t feeling your top self and you aren’t sure how to fix it.

People being old could be wisdom or vulnerability.
As you reach a state where you feel you need more wisdom or you feel dependant/
vulnerable.

2:08 can be “infinite duality.”

Announcing of your name is “you want it to be your turn”.

That’s my take on it.

post_text: Help! My friend is having a hard time he just went through a break up and every night since he’s been having the same nightmare. He stands in the middle of a ring of fire and spoke to hades the first time. Now it’s black and blurry and he hears mumbled voices then he wakes up. Any idea or any way to help him so he can stop having these dreams and not so scared to fall asleep?
comment_text: My thoughts are that he is passing through a trauma. The ring is a common symbol for a relationship, fire is anger. Speaking to hades suggests he has decended into his own "underworld", perhaps he needs to process his anger before he can break free and rise again.

post_text: Help! My friend is having a hard time he just went through a break up and every night since he’s been having the same nightmare. He stands in the middle of a ring of fire and spoke to hades the first time. Now it’s black and blurry and he hears mumbled voices then he wakes up. Any idea or any way to help him so he can stop having these dreams and not so scared to fall asleep?
comment_text:
I have heard about nightmare rehearsal therapy as a way of treating the symptoms. I can send papers about it if you'd like, but the steps are something like this:

1. Write down the dream narrative as it is
2. Write down a NEW version of the dream narrative that would turn the dream into a non-nightmare (for example, walking through the ring of fire, not being burnt, or maybe getting a hug from Hades, I don't know).
3. Practice "rehearsing" the dream in its *modified* version.
4. Supposedly this rehearsal will train the brain to modify the experience of the nightmare when it is dreamt.

To be clear I have never done this myself but the literature has shown promising results (has anyone here had success with this technique?).

Becoming lucid during the nightmare would be another strategy (I have done this and had success). If he's never lucid dreamt before it may take a bit of work, but becoming lucid and taking control of the dream would be one path.

However, I think these strategies both address the symptoms, and not the root cause. I tend to agree with Alexandra that processing the underlying emotions would be the way to truly resolve the problem, but these strategies may provide some relief if the nightmares are becoming an issue on their own.

post_text:
Hei. I have had so many sad dreams for about a year. Crying and screaming in my sleep, + it freaks my bf out.
My dad committed suicide 12 years ago, I was 11 at the time. I had a tough time dealing with it for many years, but I’ve been working on letting go and move on for about 3 years.
The dreams are very different, but it’s always the same pattern: my dad comes back for a day, week, month, and he totally ignores me. I try to talk to him but he just pushed me away and talk to everyone else. Then when it’s time for him to go back to “heaven” (I’m not a religious person), he tells me he loves me and misses me, and that I have to move on. And then I scream and cry and wake up crying.
Last night I dreamt that he was back, I was a kid again, and all my family was together looking for a house and trying to start “a new life”, everything was the way it was before he died. All my family, brother, mom, dad, grandpa and grandpa, aunts etc was sitting around a table, eating dinner. Then I “woke up”, and I was all alone by the table. So I woke up from a dream, in my dream. And I started crying and looking for my family, and I said over and over “it’s too much, I can’t take this anymore”, and then I woke up crying.
It feels like the more I’m working on moving on from my past, my dreams about family and dad gets worse. I don’t know what to do or what it means. Have anyone experienced something like this or know what it means?
comment_text:
Do you ever have a bruise on your skin Karoline Stølhaug that when you first get it, there is only a little red mark or it is hardly visible. And then a few days later, it looks horrible! It turns green, brown, purple, blue, it seems to be spreading!....

Healing can appear to get worse before it gets better 💖 trust the process

"The only way out is through"

post_text:
Hei. I have had so many sad dreams for about a year. Crying and screaming in my sleep, + it freaks my bf out.
My dad committed suicide 12 years ago, I was 11 at the time. I had a tough time dealing with it for many years, but I’ve been working on letting go and move on for about 3 years.
The dreams are very different, but it’s always the same pattern: my dad comes back for a day, week, month, and he totally ignores me. I try to talk to him but he just pushed me away and talk to everyone else. Then when it’s time for him to go back to “heaven” (I’m not a religious person), he tells me he loves me and misses me, and that I have to move on. And then I scream and cry and wake up crying.
Last night I dreamt that he was back, I was a kid again, and all my family was together looking for a house and trying to start “a new life”, everything was the way it was before he died. All my family, brother, mom, dad, grandpa and grandpa, aunts etc was sitting around a table, eating dinner. Then I “woke up”, and I was all alone by the table. So I woke up from a dream, in my dream. And I started crying and looking for my family, and I said over and over “it’s too much, I can’t take this anymore”, and then I woke up crying.
It feels like the more I’m working on moving on from my past, my dreams about family and dad gets worse. I don’t know what to do or what it means. Have anyone experienced something like this or know what it means?
comment_text:
Dream interpretation ideas (if I have more thoughts on this later I will come to add..)

I think you are dreaming of your dad more and more because while the feeling of loss was raw and unprocessed, all you felt was the grief of his loss, and the palpable absence of this person.

You felt "he is gone! He is not here!" And the pain of that was first and foremost.

Now that you are processing the grief, you are moving back to the feeling of his presence, and the joy and comfort that you felt being together with him, the love he had for you.

You always had the joy, love and comfort there too, underneath the pain of loss, but couldn't access it.

Now you can open and access this joy again, because the grief is not making you turn away from the happiness that is there.

Of course this is a scary process - opening to feeling comfort, joy, love, security, happiness, this is a reminder of how that good feeling is something that can be taken away. Which is frightening. And causes inner conflict "maybe I shouldn't feel the joy, because then it will hurt more if I lose that feeling"

The dream is telling you, "you never lost that feeling, it has always been there and it always will be there. The joy is bigger than the grief. The pain turned you away from the joy, the joy never left"

It is saying that your father, in this way, and also in how you are very much like him in many good ways, your father has never left you.

Instead of feeling his absence, you are feeling his presence, as you open up to the positive attachment you felt with him, and as you open up to the side of yourself that is very much like your father.

In the dreams, the contrast of being alone and being with family is a reminder that you are never truly alone when you have loved and been loved. For all those you connect with in life, you live in their hearts, as they live in yours. In this way, there is a life beyond death, time, and place. Karoline Stølhaug good luck to you in healing, trust the work you are doing 💙

post_text:
Hi all, I had a bit of an odd dream that I woke up from about an hour or so ago.

I can't remember specifically how it started, but there was a male individual that was ousted from my family for something he didn't do. Rather than siding with my family on this one I believed in him as I knew he could never have done what he was being accused of.

At some point, things escalated where my family was planning to chase him away, so the both of us left.

We ended up splitting when we left and I somehow ended up in my dad's apartment. No one was present but his wife, and there was a Golden Retriever there. He was filthy, and as I tried to hose him down I could see all the dirt and grime coming off of him. I thought there was no way I could let him stay there.

Well, I happened to look around and also saw there was a baby, and the baby needed it's diaper changed. That's when my dads wife came in and I became angry, telling her I was going to take the baby as it was obvious she was unfit to take care of her. She was pretty calm during the whole interaction but tried to take her baby back, but eventually relented and went back to her room while I changed the baby.

By the end of it all, I realized that I was just overreacting. At least, in terms of the baby, as it wasn't like she had been crying and put two and two together and figured the baby had probably just made a mess and it wasn't his wife's fault. However, there was definitely no excusing the neglected dog.

I went into her room with the baby and apologized, telling her I knew she was a good mom and that I was sorry for attempting to take her baby, that I knew she would never forgive me if I had taken her.

His wife told me it was alright, that the reason why she didn't fight so hard is because she knew I would make the right decision. She then told me, for whatever reason, that if I wanted from now on I could come and fold her laundry and she's pay me $1.75 every time I did her laundry. I told her no thanks and was planning to leave with the dog, but then I woke up.

I woke up feeling very sad and guilty. I don't normally remember dreams, but this one stuck with me and I couldn't really find anything online about what it could mean.
comment_text: This is about you evolving and taking a stand for yourself in life. Standing up for the male individual was you speaking up for yourself. Taking a stand in life. You speak your peace about the baby but realize that you may have pushed it a bit too much. It's because you are learning about loyalty and how it fits or works in your life. That is why you are cleaning the dog off. This represents your loyalty because dogs are very loyal. You are learning the value of being loyal and becoming loyal to the truth. That is what I see with this dream.

post_text:
Just last night, I had a hodge podge of stuff in my dream, which is typical for me.

One moment, I was back in high school classrooms, taking notes on my computer and missing lectures and assignments. The next, I was on the school's backlot watching as Sandman from Spider-Man somehow infused his sand with Peter Parker's friends, causing them to melt. Spidey then showed up and invented a a spray that reversed the effects and restore his friends. From the people who came back, I joined them and we established a village. However, a physical fight with someone caused me to get amnesia. A gal pal from college then appeared wearing a bikini and I didn't recognize her, but was intrigued by her Crush soda drink -\-\ I don't remember exactly what I said, but it was something along the lines of "It's funny you're drinking that cuz you're my crush".

I have barely any idea how these scenarios fit together, but it's interesting nonetheless. If there's no logical explanation, what would you say is the meaning behind the individual ideas?
comment_text: Jason Effinger I would tie it all in to a feeling of not being prepared or measuring up in waking life (struggling in some capacity) along with a desire to escape the doldrums of daily life.

post_text:
I usually have very vivid dreams, but I can't shake the one I had last night.
I dreamed my daughter (8yo, high functioning autism) was being mauled by a lion. Every time I'd try to take a step forward to help, the lion would bite again. She kept screaming "I'm just like my mom" trying to get it to stop. The look on her face and the screams "I'm just like my mom" just will not leave my mind.
I have had a lot of life changes in the past 3 months (new relationship after being single for years, new job, currently in the middle of moving out of my sisters house and on my own again) and I have anxiety which I'm not currently treating with medication, so I'm aware that a lot of this might be anxiety related as I've had 2 pretty severe panic attacks from this dream, but I was hoping for some outsiders opinions and maybe some tips on how to stop hyper fixating on the dream.
Any help or words of encouragement appreciated🥺
comment_text:
The key phrase seems to be "Im just like my mom" so exploring hoe you are just like your mom might be worth looking at (generally dreams are about the dreamer) but ot might also be worth reflecting on how or in what ways your daughter is also like you?

particularly framed around that the more you try to interfere the worse things get?

Was it a male lion (with a mane) or a female lioness?

Lion - pride, family, courage or cowardice, mastering wild instinct, territory

Lionness - provider, mothering, fierce protector of children

post_text: Hi all, I have mentioned before that I frequently dream of houses. So the dream before waking this morning was that I was in a house which felt like my previous home (which we sold almost two years ago) but it wasn't the same layout we were moving out in the dream. As with this dream, myself, my husband and some of my his family members were in a room that we had to clear out but there was a feeling that everything in the room was new to me, the first time I saw it. Like the furniture and the drawers were full of jewellery and ornaments which felt like they were the previous owner's and there were antique dressers and cupboards etc. All full of treasures I felt I wanted to keep as I was discovering them for the first time and I did not want to clear any of them out! Many of the dreams about houses are of the similar frequency in details.....always the house is old, there are many rooms and I keep looking for more, small or big and I sometimes find new items. Sometimes the dream is black and white but this mornings dream was in colour as the jewellery was colourful. Especially a ring I found, as I held it I dropped it and had to bend down to look for it. I found it and specifically it was a round band, half in baguette cut emeralds. Can anyone explain why the dream recurs? 1) Why the house is always old? 2) Why am I always looking for more rooms? 3) Why do I sometimes find treasures and not other times? 4) What am I constantly searching for!? Many thanks in advance :-)
comment_text:
My answers to your questions:

1) the house represents you, you might be like an "old soul" or maybe linking to what was there before you were even born ie traits you are born with

2) the search for new rooms I tie to self discovery, lessons in knowing thyself

3) the treasures I'd link to what you treasure, soul wealth rather than material wealth so not how you make a buck but what you value which is in my opinion worth a whole heap more

4) I think you are constantly searching for you, self understanding and perhaps spiritual truth

Reoccuring typically means something crucial i must pay attention to/ focus on.
comment_text: hmm although you arent afraid you still avoid your fear and don't confront the problems in life maybe?

post_text: Thank you for accepting my request this is going to be a long post. Years ago after I split up with my son's father I started seeing a man named Earl. We had a really good time together. I really liked him. He had problems though and he drank way too much. He would get sloppy drunk almost every day. So I had to break it off with him. I didn't want to but I couldn't help him and at the time I had a 3 year old to care for that didn't need to be around a falling down drunk. It broke his heart when I ended things. He blew my phone up for over a week begging me for another chance. I stood my ground and kept telling him no. One evening my son and I were at a friend's house when he showed up crying drunk still begging me. I was annoyed so I grabbed my son and we went home and went to bed. That night I dreamt that his identical brother died. The dream was so vivid. I remember being really worried about Earl. I was looking everywhere for him to see if he was okay. I finally found him and he was just standing there smiling at me. I ran up to him and told him I was sorry about the loss of his brother and he didn't say a word he just kept smiling. I went to hug him and it was one of those really long hugs that you don't want to end. Then I woke up. About 10 mins after I woke his sister called me to inform me that he had passed away in the night. He overdosed. Am I crazy for thinking that really wasn't a dream? I believe his soul was telling me goodbye. Does anyone have any thoughts or opinions on this occurrence? Please and thank you.
comment_text:
Long reply, but.., On the one hand it would makes sense that you would dream about him after such an emotional experience happening in your real life. It makes sense that you would want to go to him and hug him, as you had to fight your own desires to leave in the first place. His smile could simply be relief that you had sought him out after trying so hard to win you back.

On the other hand, I’ve met people with similar dreams, for lack of better term, that are really uncanny and hard to dismiss. I’ve had some myself... So while I can’t say it is, I wouldn’t tell you that it’s not, and you certainly aren’t crazy for considering all options.
